It was very cold (only about 15 C) but it is colder in Canada where we were coming from, so the kids went for a swim at around 5 pm They were having a great time playing "shark"- with lots of squealing, splashing and laughing that goes along with fun in a pool. (I should add that we were the only people in the beautiful pool area, as it was cold). The adults were sitting and talking around the outdoor fire and the kids were in the pool playing. It was 6 pm. Suddenly, a neighbour (the hotels pool area butts up against a residential neighbourhood, but due to a high wall and clever landscaping, you don't really notice) started screaming over the wall for our kids to shut up or she would call the police. Yep, at 6 pm on a friday night, the sound of children having fun..call the police. She yelled at us a few times. A few minutes later, a Kimpton employee comes out and tells up that they had a complaint, could we keep it down. We pointed out the time, and the employee agreed but still asked us to be quiet, which kind of put us off. We left the area soon after, the fun having been sucked out of that experience. I think if you live next door to a very large hotel, and about 100 feet off Wilshire in LA, you are used to a little noise...no? I guess it was the sound of children's laughter that was the problem...I can't imagine the neighbour was sitting outside, as it was chilly. Not the hotels fault, but a drag nonetheless. Needless to say, the kids didn't want to swim again in the remaining days we were there. A good hotel, clean, stylish, and in a great location. Just try to hold back on any joyful noise.

Reviews.Title: “Underperformed - Probably due to these inaccurate Rave Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: lawyerkelly
Reviews.Content: I need to preface my review - a majority of my bad experience was due to the greeting we received at the front desk. First impressions do count. After conducting major research, I had very high expectations of this hotel. I was under the impression that I would be given first-class service. Boy, was I wrong. I am a faithful Yelper - I review everything. I myself own a service-based business, so I always go where other travelers rave about the service. My personal pet peeve is inflexibility in service. When we checked in at noon, the girl at the front desk was pleasant. But she wasn't overly enthusiastic, nor was she particularly nice. I requested a complimentary upgrade based on availability. Before she even checked, she said, "We can put you on the south side where it's quieter, but that's about it." I told her we lived in the local area, and just visiting Westwood for a short stay. No response. I told her I am a Bruin and just coming back to visit! No response. I told her that I had high expectations of this hotel, based on the reviews I read on TripAdvisor, and that I am a faithful reviewer. NO RESPONSE. (Um, isn't "charisma" part of the front desk job descrip?) Anyway, I finally asked if there were "suites" available. She said, "Yes, but there is a upgrade fee of $99, but we can give it to you for $40". I said ok. 5 minutes later, the upgrade fee became $ 49. (how did it go up 20% in 5 minutes?) Since I was tired, I didn't argue. I read about the $1 upgrade for all these amenities. I asked her about it. She snidely told me that that was for customers that paid online their best available rate. Then she added, "You definitely didn't pay what the room is worth". Ok. I admit, I booked on Priceline. But 1) So what? and 2) How does she know how much I paid? For all she knows, I overbid and am paying more! Mentioning this gave me a bad taste in my mouth. Ready to jet to my room, I asked her for my child's gift. The Palomar website touted that all kids get free "kid gifts". She said that they "ran out" of these gift packages and then gave us a basket full of dinosaurs and bracelets. My husband took a dinosaur, and I reached for a bracelet, and she gave me a look like, "No, you can't take both". Finally, I asked for a crib and a high chair. (The website said that you can deliver a high chair to the room for in-room dining). She said no, we don't do that. I said, "It says you can." She said, "No.". Then this other lady said, "Only in our restaurant". HOW HARD IS IT TO GET A HIGH CHAIR TO A ROOM? Especially since you say you do that on your website??!? They DID later deliver the high chair, but it was like pulling teeth. The hotel is pet-friendly, which is very nice. However, a pet-friendly hotel has consequences. There is an "animal" smell in the halls and carpets, and there is hair in the carpets. Our room - a spa suite - was pretty spacious. The set-up was nice, but personally, I thought there was too much clunky furniture. Also, I am not particularly fond of snakeskin (the cabinets have them). The decor is definitely very modern, and I realized I prefer traditional. I am not fond of red doors and such. The bed was comfy and it was pretty clean. The location was very close to UCLA - walkable, and overall, the hotel is very nice. We paid approximately $250 with taxes for the spa suite, and I thought the value was worth it, especially in this area. $33 for parking sucks. Internet is not free. The rest of the staff that we encountered seemed very helpful and genuinely nice. I guess we just had bad luck at check-in. I don't know. I think overall, it is a nice hotel. I was overly excited to stay here after the rave reviews on service. I think my expectations were probably a bit skewed because of the reviews. Since we are local, I don't think we would stay here again. We just wanted a quick getaway and didn't really get blown away by service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Westwood area”
Reviews.Author: MrHao
Reviews.Content: Though I can't say I was as blown away as others who've written raves, I found my stay at the Hotel Palomar to be enjoyable. After flying from Asia we arrived around 2pm tired and in desperate need of a shower, but were unable to be shown to a room that early. The girl at check-in had thought there were rooms ready, but the system wouldn't let her assign us to any of them due to (it seemed) the booking code (Priceline) and so we had to wander Westwood until an appropriate room was ready. The room itself was adequate, but I wouldn't describe it as especially large or luxurious. It was a nice, well-appointed room for a hotel of this category and price point. Parking for $33 sucks, as others have pointed out. I find the "that's what all parking garages in this area charge" response to be offensive. As a guest of a hotel, paying it a fair sum for my stay, I don't think its unreasonable that use of that hotel's garage would be discounted or included. If I eat at a restaurant in the Westwood area its not at all uncommon to get validated parking for a period of time consistent with my meal. Seems reasonable that a hotel could offer the same to its paying guests. Also, the bar closes at like 10pm or so, which seemed pretty early by LA standards. Service from front desk, valet, etc, was consistently good, but again, no more so than I'd expect from a hotel of this class. In short, it was a very good stay, and I would consider staying again. Perhaps I expected too much from reviews on TripAdvisor, as I was pleased, but not blown-away.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Fast Valet & NIce Rooms”
Reviews.Author: babygame
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay to drop my daughter off at UCLA - was there for 4 nights. On arrival, we were tired from long drive and decided to relax at the pool; to our surprise there were 2 business meetings going on there. Not sure why they allowed this, as it made us as "guests" feel a little uncomfortable lounging in our suits and swimming. Lounges at pool are great and albeit there is limited sun, we were able to relocate to sun. Pool was a little cool but refreshing. Service was absulutely astounding; everyone was really ready to please - so refreshing. Didn't really like having to valet park the car at $33 per day (with tax), but the service was very fast. Enjoyed the location, as it gave me an incentive to walk around the area between the hotel and UCLA; loved the walks! Was a little hard to remember the location at night when driving back - all the high rises on Wilshire look the same at night - luckily I remembered the cross-street (Selby) with the light! Room was comfie, but it got a little warm at night - finally changed the AC fan to "hI' and this helped a lot. Used the mini-bar as my personal refrigerator (put the stuff in the closet) and liked having a room safe and easy access to ice. Would stay here again. Free internet would have been nice (instead of $10 per day). But the front desk did my searches for me, and printed me out directions as needed. Check-out day was pirate day which looked like a fun idea!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: scarletpolyglot
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, receptive and quick to respond to requests. When we ordered room service, the food was excellent. As for the rooms, we were extremely comfortable - no complaints. The hotel bar is very classy and the bartender, in addition to being cheerful and welcoming, makes excellent cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Some great things - others not so much”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLori
Reviews.Content: First the good: I stayed here for 3 nights with my teenage daughter, while visiting local colleges. The Front desk staff were wonderful upon check in and very helpful with driving directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. Overall, I found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is also in a great location if you need to visit UCLA or have business in the Westwood Village area. A word of caution - we found the Westwood Village area a bit seedy, MANY homeless people wandering the streets an harassing patrons of the local restaurants and shops. The village itself seems to be in need of a business boost - many of the storefronts are empty. Where the hotel fell down - simple things that one takes for granted: The order form for breakfast (the door hang tag) was left in our room on the first night only - didn't receive one for the remaining two nights. The hotel offers a complimentary wine tasting most evenings - there were empty wine glasses left in the hallway for two nights - yuk! We NEVER received turn down service or fresh toiletries. The bath linens are really cheap and thin - really almost bare - some upgrading in towels is necessary. It's a good, serviceable hotel and good value. Having said that, if you can afford more, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Afordable, Confortable, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Tarpon_Traveller
Reviews.Content: New spot. Rooms are large and confortable. Silent as well. Very well located if you have meetings in the commercial bulidings in the surroundings (walking distance). Nice staff and afordable price on breakfast. Recommend for business or leisure travelers. I paid some 200 usd.

Reviews.Title: “The Palomar is my "go to" hotel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Belleau
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA a few times a year because of its proximity to UCLA. I've stayed at other properties just to become more familiar with the hotel offerings in Westwood, but I always come back to the Palomar as my #1 choice. The rooms are stylish, so comfortable, and just big enough. I really like the decor in the restaurant, it feels intimate without having that dark, heavy feel. The evening wine offering is great, as well as the morning coffee. Sometimes it takes a while to get your car when they are really busy, but they try hard! The staff aims to please.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and rooms; great value”
Reviews.Author: SouthernHospitality2
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Palomar in early September. It was our first time to LA, and we found the location to be very good for sightseeing, even though LA is huge and there's no way to be close to everything. It's located in Westwood near UCLA, just a few short minutes from Beverly Hills, Bel Air and West Hollywood by car. Lots of very trendy restaurants, bars and shopping within easy driving distance, as well as some of the most exclusive neighborhoods. It's near the 405, so although it was a 30 minute drive or so to Malibu and those beaches, it was very easy to get to and not really that far for LA. Only about 20 minutes from LAX (without traffic). Only downside is that there aren't cafes or bars immediately adjacent to the hotel, but the area around UCLA is packed with these and is only a few blocks away. As for the hotel itself, I really have no complaints. We got a good deal to begin with, and upon arrival they offered to upgrade us to a suite for just $38/night, which we accepted. The suite was great - quiet, roomy, trendy and modern (like the rest of the hotel), but tastefully decorated (not obnoxious as sometimes occurs when hotels try too hard). The bed was fine, even if not the best I've ever slept in, and the living and bath areas were very spacious and well furnished (the bath had both a walk-in shower and huge jetted tub as well as double sinks). Very large flatscreen televisions located in both the bedroom and living room area. The staff was also great - very friendly, helpful and professional, even the valets. They immediately fixed the only (minor) problem we had - apparently the housekeeper forgot to leave washcloths in our room, but these were quickly brought up. Although we did not partake, the bar and restaurant looked nice, and the hotel had a complimentary wine happy hour each night we were there. Nice touch. In summary, I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay in this general vicinity, especially if you can get a competitive rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfort, a little bumpy for business purposes”
Reviews.Author: teainthesierras
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel and the staff is excellent. It's within a nice 3 or 4 block walk to the Westwood business district. If you stay on the upper floors you'll not hear any traffic on Wilshire and you'll have a great view. I really liked it. The wine hour is cool. And if I ever go on vacation in L.A. I'd definitely consider coming back. Although, the Internet didn't work in my room when I arrived but the staff got it working. If I were a vacationer that would not be such a big deal. But on one small point which is actually important for some business travelers, the Palomar's pricing model is not such a good fit for companies like mine that budget travel in advance. I'd rather pay $200 a night and have everything included (parking, Internet, business services, morning coffee, etc.) and no worries, then pay $150 a night with $50 in unanticipated costs. It's nice to return home and not have an accounting task figuring out my allowable hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accomidations”
Reviews.Author: SpecialAgentMulder
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked for me by a travel site and I can't believe how lucky I was to get put here. I was visiting LA for the first time in 13 years and when we lived there, our housing was taken care of by the venue we performed at so this was my first stay at a hotel in Southern CA. The only thing I can even remotely begin to complain about is the fact that the valet was $20 a night and that's REALLY finding something to nit pick at. I'm used to New York where parking is like selling your first born. The room was clean and spacious and more than I needed as a solo traveler and would think a group of three would have been more than comfortable. The room also had a plethora of items for travelers who forgot an item at home or simply for those that like to travel light. The staff also arranged to mail a package for me so I didn't have to lug it back East on my flight. It looks as if the hotel offers a lot of amenities but since I am not social by nature, I didn't take advantage of those. The location is near Beverly Hills shopping and that was a day gone right there ;) I was in town for a celebrity charity event held farther down on Wilshire so I was happy with the proximity of that as well. I hadn't had Jack In The Box in years and there was one a short drive away. I have horribly poor sleeping habits but 2 out of my 4 nights were good. I have nothing negative to say really. I usually stay at a Four Season if there is one in the city I'm visiting but I am now a fan of Kimpton properties and stay at them in Chicago, New York and the newly opened one in Philly. Billed as 4 stars but in my opinion a very economical hotel. I don't make a lot of money and value where I spend my dollar and was happy I got so much for a good price. Planning on being back in LA in November and December and hope to stay at this property on those visits.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place for older children”
Reviews.Author: lmtak
Reviews.Content: We chose the Palomar after much research and based on reviews from friends that had stayed previously. Join the In Touch loyalty program before you reserve. it allows for many perks when you arrive/reserve. We got free internet and continental breakfast during our stay. that was the promotion at the time. Also a 10 dollar mini bar rebate (not much, but a nice touch). Hotel is dog very freindly, with water bowls and welcome signs for the dogs. Rooms are quite roomy, we were three woman in the room and had lots of space.Bathrrom was good size and stalked with items. Not many electrical plugs for electronics...The hotel also has a long list of "if you forgot" stuff free of charge. Location is about 1 mile from santa Monica Blvd, which is a main thourough fare to most sites and streets. Westwood village is a walk away with UCLA there. brentwood is a two minute drive and Beverly hills even less. Took abaout 10 minutes to drive to great shopping and trendy areas. Meter parking on the streets where we drove and lots of good lots. Only thing that bugged me was the 33 dollar parking fee. Valets suggest that there is street parking, but not many spaces and not really convenient. Most hotels that we looked at had similar parking fees. Pool is not great either, being situated inthe middle of 2 buildings, so not much sun. No ceoffee machine in the room, but coffee bar in the morning in the "receptionarea" and wine and sangria hour in the same from 5 to 6.( both free). Staff all around , were sensational!!! All problems solved in minutes and with a smile..Contnental breakfast was deliscious and fresh and out dietary restrictions were wll taken care of.....all in all a great hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with wonderful staff - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CharleyCharley
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend the last night of our vacation in SoCal here and what a great decision that was! From the moment we arrived we were treated so well by every member of staff that we came across. The valet/porter who helped with the luggage was so charming. The concierge was friendly and helpful... and as for the hotel and rooms itself - well they were beautiful!! Tasteful, quiet, sooo comfortable and loved the wine hour too!! Everything about the Palomar was amazing especially the wonderful staff! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hotel Palomar for a full week and I was very happy. I have found that a lot of the hotels in the LA area seem to be older but remodeled, this one was not. I got great sleep and you couldn't hear people in the room next to you. If you have stayed in LA you know this is a common problem. The staff went above and beyond at every turn. I don't have any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good--we stay there twice a year”
Reviews.Author: weedpatch
Reviews.Content: Sorry to read a "disappointed" review of this hotel--the guest must have been having a bad day. This hotel is located at the south end of Westwood, perfect for parents visiting students at UCLA. There is an excellent, completely organic (!) restaurant in the hotel, complete with free wine in the evening, and plenty of restaurants in Westwood. (The restaurant is decorated with dark brown making it a little gloomy but big deal.) The rooms and bathrooms are large enough that my 6'6" husband does not feel cramped. The staff is very courteous and agreeable; concierge was very helpful. The hotel is on a busy street but there is no noise factor, and the (safe) residential neighborhoods around it are great to walk around. The only thing I agree with is that the car valet could go faster. PS Try the Napa Valley Grill in Westwood. Very good, very lively!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in LA. Nice rooms..

Reviews.Title: “THE best experience!”
Reviews.Author: KWIZHartford
Reviews.Content: We arrived late from a harrowing trip up the coast from San Diego (I was alone with my 2 kids)...Josue checked us in, smiling, professional. Actually took the time to notice my 7 year old was cold, and shivering - -asked if he was o.k. Five minutes after we got to our room there was a knock: Josue himself - -with a mug of warm milk for my son, fresh cookies, a glass of wine for me and an apple tart! What an amazing person, and what wonderful service. We never felt like "just another hotel guest". Entire stay was like this -- great desk staff, a courtesy van brought that us to the Getty Center, and even to pick up dinner at a take out Thai place! One of the best of all the wonderful Kimptons at we've stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: stoi1
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best services we have experienced in any of the hotels my family and I stayed before. Receptionist accommodated our early arrival. Paul the concierge was great with restaurant recommendation and booking a tour. The room was nice and the beds very comfortable. Located very conveniently between Santa Monica and Hollywood. In all very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Westwood, Los Angeles. I have stayed in the Kimpton Hotel (Solamar) in San Diego a couple of times and I enjoyed my stay in this Hotel in San Diego very much (wine hour, hip/trendy decor). I therefore decided to book a similar hotel in Los Angeles. The rooms are nice and clean. Not very large but nicely decorated. I purchased a 1$ breakfast voucher - the breakfast is simple but good (coffee, juice, fruitbowl, toast or muffin). The Palomar Hotel is also offering the free wine hour - nice :)! The hotel has a small swimming pool and free internet (wifi). There is a nice area with a couple of restaurants nearby the Hotel. I certainly recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: ItalophileNJ
Reviews.Content: We had two "Vista" rooms in this lovely hotel. The room was a decent size, if not overly large, with space for clothes and a well fitted out bathroom. The hotel has a pool; I didn't see it but my (adult) daughter said it was nice, although seating area is small. Service was pleasant, with particularly helpful concierges and fairly quick retrieval of cars. My one complain would be the restaurant; it would have been nice if it had been possible to get more casual meals there, and if lunch (as opposed to an all day breakfast-like brunch) were served weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault, this is a flawless hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AKATCambridge
Reviews.Content: Such a fantastic experience. The hotel is in a lovely area of LA , the service is amazing and the hotel itself is the perfect balance between a chic/modern interior with an element of true comfort. The staff at the desk were very helpful ptoviding us with insider info with regards to great places to eat and playparks in the locality. My 5 year old son was welcomed with a rootle in a toy basket (so that was him impressed). The parking is valet and therefore not cheap at $33 per night but that is the same in any hotel with valet parking. But other than that, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, stylish, great service, AND free wine hour!”
Reviews.Author: Grace99
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is hip, stylish & service minded. Our room was spotless. The pool was dreamy. Free lemonade & iced tea is a lovely perk. The wine & sangria hour is reason alone to choose this hotel. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “A hip little gem with stellar service!”
Reviews.Author: leeperk
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a business trip working with UCLA and discovered the Palomar through them. UCLA has a corporate account with the Palomar, so rates were very affordable especially for a Los Angeles hotel. I don't know if it is the Kimpton policy, or specific to his hotel, but the customer service is the best I've experienced. Every employee always said hello or asked if there was anything with which they could help me. And, I felt as though they meant it. If you order room service breakfast, there is an option to also get your boarding pass delivered with it, which is great! The in-room furnishings and fixtures are modern and really nice. It seems to me they have thought of everything. I'm going back 3 more times in the next 3 months and can't wait to stay there again. They are also very pet friendly, and if I were traveling with my dog, I'd love to be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: JMACKSD
Reviews.Content: The service was the most stellar part of this hotel. Every single person on the staff we encountered were always smiling and making sure we were taken care of. The location is right on the edge of Westwood. If I was traveling alone, it would be walkable to the heart of Westwood, but with young children, that just wouldn't happen. The rooms were very modern. Clean bathrooms with plush towels and nice fixtures. Not your standard drab hotel room. The only thing was the room felt a little on the small side, maybe it was our specific room, it was on a corner and just felt tight. Nice extras, not sure if these were seasonal, but complimentary coffee/tea in the morning, iced tea/lemonade in the afternoon, and a wine hour in the evening. Nice touch, although we didn't have a chance to make ti back for any of the wine hours, so I can't say much about it. The $33 valet parking is a little steep. We tried to look for street parking, but didn't have any luck. I would have preferred self parking, as we were in and out quite often, and when I add the tipping to that $33 per day price, it ends up being over $40 per day in reality. The one disappointment I had with the hotel was the pool. It wasn't heated, and although it was a nice mid-70's day in Los Angles in June, how the shade moves the pool was completely in the shade in the afternoon and it was just plain freezing. No hot tub. However, the chaises loungers were comfortable to relax in, and there was a fireplace. I'm not sure how old this hotel is, but I get the feeling that this was a bit of an afterthought, and they are probably doing the best they could with the space. It's just hard with such a tall building blocking the sun. So as long as you aren't looking for a nice pool vacation, this is a great little hotel. Close to action in Westwood, Santa Monica, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and Fairfax.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: SpeedSki
Reviews.Content: I lived in Westwood 4 years while attending UCLA and was anxious to find just the right place to stay when coming back for a wedding. The Palomar was just right. It is relatively new and well kept. Although quite plain on the outside, much attention has been paid to the interior. Very modern looking, and comfortable rooms. Easy walking distance to all that Westwood Village has to offer. We were looking for a place to eat because the hotel restaurant was not open yet. One of the staff immediately produced a walking map with mutiple dining options on it. The staff was very friendly and helpful without any attitude. We came to attend a wedding at the Mormon Temple in West LA and I had requested in advance a room with a view of the temple. Also had requested to be on a upper floor for less traffic noise. The woman who checked us in gave us several options to make sure that we got an upper room with the view we wanted. We had no complaints on the room or the service. The only small downside was that the parking options are to park on the street (Wilshire Blvd) or to do valet parking at $33/day. Self parking in the hotel's 4 level parking garage would be a nice option. Overall, a very good value for the location and how new and clean and nice the rooms were. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Jaw dropping customer service, terrific hotel...couldn't ask for more....”
Reviews.Author: Inluvwithjapan
Reviews.Content: This sums up our visit to the Palomar Hotel (Westwood). As we checked out and the valet brought our car to the circular drive. One valet, loaded our luggage and the other valet opened the door for my wife. Nothing out of the ordinary. As we sat in our car and about ready to pull away, the valet saw an old drink in our cupholder, and two coffee cups about ready to search for an empty cupholder...the valet asked us if we'd like him to toss the old drink for us...AND then, he pulled the shoulder/seat belt harness so that my wife could secure herself in the car. Now, how many places do the little things like that for customers? Just typical customer service things that took place during our entire stay. Hotel is terrific, staff is perfect and the hotel rooms are exceptional. I can't say enough good things about the attention to detail here. One of the best kept secrets in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel without the LA Attitude”
Reviews.Author: BestValueHunter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 3 nights recently and thoroughly enjoyed my visit. The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Everyone seemed to have a smile on their face and was never condescending or pushy. The valet/bell staff were always working hard. I hate it when they just shuffle their feet and take their time, but this was NOT the case at the Hotel Palomar. The front desk staff were very helpful, taking care of a few billing irregularities without fuss or complaints. Thank you! Didn't get a chance to dine at the restaurant, but when walking by, it did look great. Next time I'm in need of a hotel in West LA, this will certainly be on the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality boutique hotel that would recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: pinchivida
Reviews.Content: Went for Memorial weekend with my girlfriend. We got what we wanted, The room were perfect with good quality and perfect beds. We layed by the pool all day and it was perfect, you feel like its your own private pool, with not much people around. Ordered food by the pool and I could say is one of the best pancakes I have tasted. I wish there was someone that would stop by from time to time to see if we needed anything instead us having to call them everytime we wanted a beer but besides that service was excellent. Location is perfect blocks from Rodeo Dr and 3 miles away from Getty Museum which I recommend to anyone that has not being there.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mlturken
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a wonderful surprise. The Palomar is located in a wonderful area just adjacent to Beverly Hills with easy access to many of the areas finest restaurants, shopping, and to the beautiful campus of UCLA. On our arrival, we were met by an enthusiastic and extremely courteous staff that offered us incredible service with smiles and efficiency that we have not seen in years. The hotel is very modern, spotless, and elegant. The lobby, elevators, restaurants, bars, and even hallways are decorated in a splash of vibrant colors and textures that make the entire hotel both sophisticated and stylish. Our room was standard size but decorated in modern decor with new and elegant appearing lamps and furniture and sporting a beautiful bathroom with with high end toiletries. The mattresses were incredibly supportive (as if they were new), the rugs thick and clean, the television was large (a 40 inch lcd), and the room even had a wonderful ipod adapted clock radio. Internet service was fast and complimentary. For the service and amenities offered by the Palomar Hotel, one could not do any better even if they chose to stay at a hotel at twice the cost. My husband and I have stayed in many fine hotels over the years; the Palomar ranks among the best we have experienced . M.L. Turken Boulder, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Broken toilet, never properly resolved”
Reviews.Author: KARZRKEWL
Reviews.Content: In general the hotel is very impressive and is clean and stylish throughout. One glaring omission was the condition of our toilet. When Eric the bellhop took us to our room he noted the toilet was making a strange noise and suggested we call the hotel engineer to have a look at it. I told him we would when we left for dinner since before that we would use the bathroom to get ready. This was the first opportunity for your hotel staff to rectify the situation. Eric could have moved us to a new room immediately since we hadn't unpacked yet. He did not make the offer. We subsequently discovered that the toilet was not working at all. When we returned to the room (after the engineer supposedly fixed the toilet) that night with two friends the toilet worked sporadically, but at least after several attempts the toilet always flushed. The next morning the toilet broke again this time permanently and AFTER I had already used it. My girlfriend and I had to use the shower with the toilet smelling and the toilets in the lobby downstairs before going out for the day. The front desk said they would send up the engineer again to fix it this time. I inquired about packing up our stuff and moving to another room but the person at the front desk insisted we try fixing it again. This was the second opportunity for someone at the hotel to adequately deal with the problem. When my girlfriend and I came back to the room again that afternoon I tested the toilet one time before using it so I would not be subjected to the humiliation of using the toilet only to have it not work for a second time. It only flushed once and then stopped working. This was the THIRD time that our toilet had broken after being looked at by the engineer TWICE. I spoke to the manager on duty and requested a room change which at that point was granted. It was the THIRD time before my request to change room was granted. We had already been in the room 24 hrs and had to re-pack our things that by this time were in various places around the room. I was the one who booked this hotel and vouched for its status as a "luxury boutique hotel" and quite frankly I was very embarrassed. A working toilet is hardly a luxury. I just signed up to be an In touch member with every intention of staying at Kimpton Hotels in the future but this horrible experience and the chronic lack of anyone with the ability to deal with it immediately would be enough to ensure I never stay at another. Do not stay at this hotel if using a working toilet is something you expect for 175 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, friendly staff, yummy restaurant and good location”
Reviews.Author: Familygdl
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 2 occasions during our recent trip for a total of 5 nights and were very happy with our choice which was based on other traveller reviews. The bell staff were friendly, the concierge and reception staff helpful. We had a city view room looking out to the ocean in the distance - pretty night lights. The room size including the bathroom was good for the 3 of us. We usually avoid hotel restaurants but Blvd 16 was very good = very impressed with the service too. Wine reception nice touch (hubby would have liked beer!). Swam in the pool - cool patio area with outdoor fire. Good location a few blocks from Westwood Village - shops, cafes/restaurants (try Tanini - nice italian), cinemas. Easy bus to Santa Monica where we had a great day on hired bicycles.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: beakr
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay, I was able to check in early and I had a king suite which was on the corner so I had no problems with noisy neighbors. The Room including the bathroom was huge! The staff was excellent and very efficient. Will stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent with Kimpton concept”
Reviews.Author: leica510
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler I favor boutique hotels, and in particular Kimptons, for high level of personal service and comfortable accommodations (lots of easy accessible outlets - business hotels, take note). The Palomar for the most part hits all the right notes, starting with attentive front desk - check in was a breeze, and the room quiet and clean. Only surprise was the morning yoga class - felt a bit like a bait & switch as the instructor was dropping subtle hints that her real job is private training celebrities. Go for a walk in Westwood instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Youngatheart1958
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Palomar with our daughters while visiting our son at UCLA. We have stayed there several times since August, 2008 when we attended the UCLA orientation. Many members of the valet/bell and restaurant staff have remained the same. They appear to enjoy their work, and are a very pleasant group of people. We did have to wait several hours to check in due to limited availability of the adjoining rooms we had requested, and were given complimentary continental breakfast coupons for our stay by the personable desk clerk. The location is excellent and convenient to anywhere in LA. There are many nice touches in the lobby. We had the opportunity to see the President's Motorcade pass in front of the hotel one morning which was completely unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Forgotten Wake-up calls”
Reviews.Author: mbraynard
Reviews.Content: They forgot my wake-up call.... twice. They don't have an automated system. They manually call you - and they forgot, on two different days. That plus the lovely $33 a day parking fee means LOOK ELSEWHERE, traveler!

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: annbury
Reviews.Content: Palomar is in West LA and is very convenient to many of the local sights. We were able to take our pet dog, and the staff treated him very well. Very modern, very comfortable, and extremely reasonably priced. Also easy and convenient valet parking. We will stay there again when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good”
Reviews.Author: osteopath69
Reviews.Content: My major concern is quality of sleep. I had a very quiet room facing away from the street. I had no problem sleeping. Of course, if I had had an unusually noisy neighbor I might have had a different experience. I can't recommend this place enough. I would absolutely return if I needed to come to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: sussed_nl
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've been to a few hotels in LA and this one is by far my fave. Nice modern, clean rooms with great beds. The location was perfect for me as I was able to get to the Silverlake area and Santa Monica fairly easy. The doormen were very friendly and the service good. I will definitely return to this hotel when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoydNm
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Palomar in Los Angeles. It is a beautiful hotel; the staff was very efficient, friendly and helpful. After a minor glitch with our reservation, the blond lady with the cute accent from the desk, immediately and pleasantly corrected the situation. Our room had an amazing view plus the bed was extremely comfortable, making for a wonderfully good night's sleep. We have stayed in many hotels worldwide and The Palomar has THE most comfortable beds and pillows we have ever encountered. We had breakfast in the morning in the restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed the food AND the service. Hotel facilities are very good, with a well equipped gym, a small but adequate pool, a nice bar and a good restaurant as well as very good toiletries in the bathroom which were replenished daily. Room service was prompt, efficient and friendly. The one downside to the hotel is that room service is over-priced for what you get; I would recommend walking over the Westwood Village for restaurants. Overall this hotel is great, we would definitely recommend it to a friend and we will be returning in the very near future. As others have mentioned, please be sure to take advantage of free wine hour! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Overrated”
Reviews.Author: footnotesetc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located and the staff, generally helpful and friendly. However, the "continental breakfast" on 4 out of 6 mornings is dry toast, butter, jam, coffee, juice and a very small fruit salad of mostly watermelon. The bed is comfortable, but the feather bed is not hypoallergenic; I woke up in the morning with swollen eyes. On the third day, I concluded it must be the feather bed and slept on top of the comforter and my eyes were better. (The hotel should have made sure the feathers in the feather bed were cleaned properly and is hypoallergenic). I've slept in other hotels with feather beds, including in my home and have never had a problem, because the feather beds are HYPOLLERGENIC! Last, but not least the room is generally clean, but the shower could use a scrubbingâ€“there is brown mold.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel at a cheap prices!!”
Reviews.Author: bobcat1966
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel with a real luxury feel to it. Cool lobby and very sleek looking rooms. My room had the leopard skin look to it. Bathroom was spotless ( a must) big tub/shower and very comfy bed. I used the business center quite a bit, my computer was giving me problems. Nice little biz center with free printer and paper. My only food experience was with room service at breakfast. Steel cut oatmeal with fruit platter, coffee and juice. It was good it was fast and it was expensive. But we all know how this works right! Go to Mel's on Sunset for cheaper (not cheap). I did the Hotwire bid for this hotel and submitted Beverly Hills/Westwood. Got the Palomar for $159. A great deal plus I was close to my meeting in Century City. Oh almost forgot, GREAT fitness center! New, clean very serious equipment. Nice size room with a view. Towels and cold water on hand, it's the little things sometimes. Very friendly, nice and of course attractive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanm3320
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 14-year-old daughter stayed at Hotel Palomar for five nights for Spring Break. I, at first, thought we should stay in a hotel near the Santa Monica pier but decided that the Palomarâ€™s location near I-405 would cut down on the amount of time we spent navigating LAâ€™s traffic. That turned out to be a good decision. Plus the Palomar offers lower rates than the beach hotels, larger rooms and other generous perks including coffee and tea service from 6-9 a.m., free parking for hybrids and free wifi. (To get free wi-fi you have to join a Kimpton club online but membership is free.) Itâ€™s a pleasure to stay at a hotel where you donâ€™t feel nickeled and dimed. We had a wonderful stay at the Palomar. Every staff member we interacted with--from the doormen to the concierge--was friendly and helpful. We never had to wait more than a few seconds for the elevator or a few minutes for our car to be retrieved from its parking place. We stayed in a suite on the 12th floor with a king-sized bed in the bedroom and a pullout sofa in the living room. From our suite, we had a wonderful view of LA clear to the beach. The large, beautifully appointed bathroom was equipped with two sinks, a wonderful large shower, and a brand new, large soaking tub with jets. To save time, we ate one dinner and several breakfasts in the hotel's restaurant, which was great although a bit pricey. There are less expensive alternatives nearby. The hotel has a small fitness facility equipped with good treadmills, ellipticals and a recumbent bike and handweights and mats. It is clean and bright. We also swam laps in the rooftop pool, which is small but clean and adequate. You do have to contend with traffic sounds, but I had no trouble falling asleep in the sun on a comfortable chaise lounge after touring LA all morning. Using the Palomar as our base, we walked the mile through Westwood to UCLA and drove to the Getty and to other sites in the area. Next time I head down to LA, Iâ€™ll look no further in my hotel search than the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sunnurs
Reviews.Content: top spot to stay. safe area. easy for public transport, restaurants etc. lovely rooms. pleasant helpful staff. clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good but noise issues”
Reviews.Author: MsNancy10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Palomar in the past and never noticed until this trip how loud the toilet is when flushed. I could hear my neighbors toilet, the room above and even across the hall. It woke me up both nights I stayed at the hotel. Considering my trip was for business and I really needed to be well rested for long days at the office, I was somewhat disappointed. There were a couple of small things too that I noticed in the bathroom, a towel with some stains, hair in the tub- but I am willing to overlook that at an otherwise nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing service I've experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Ravingfan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in the Palomar while doing medical tests for her at the UCLA Medical Center. I was astounded with the customer service from the minute we were greeted at our car. Each employee we encountered had an extremely positive and 'make it happen'- attitude. They anticipated and met all our needs before I thought of them. The manager and even head chef of their restaurant personally greeted us and followed up to be certain our every need was met. Our room was flawless. Our view of the city and ocean was breathtaking. I had a question about our flat screen and they immediately were ready to send a "technician" - which we didn't need. From my business and HR background I took note of how fast, efficient and attentive they were. These are traits I've come to expect and desire in places I stay but they were more than a cut above. Various staff at different times remembered my daughter's name, initiated conversation and treated her like royalty. This was a tremendous morale boost during her treatments. She beamed during the entire stay. My daughter said as we pulled out, "They made me feel like a rock star Dad!" I've never seen anything like it. Only thing any where near close might be our recent Disney cruise. I didn't expect this from a hotel that catered so well to customers on business. A few weeks after our stay I contacted the manager to thank him (He gave me his business card at check-in) and inquire on future reservations and unique requests for those I was referring. (He still remembered our names and asked about my daughter.)They met every promise precisely, quickly and elegantly. I've enjoyed the SF Palomar but I am a RAVING fan of Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for visiting UCLA”
Reviews.Author: travelboundsandiego
Reviews.Content: My son and I were on a college road trip and spent 1 night here as we were touring UCLA the next morning. We were exhausted after a long drive and this hotel was perfect. The staff was incredibly friendly and the valet even offered information about UCLA and USC. Upon check-in, we were given 2 continental breakfast vouchers in lieu of the complimentary wine/beer coupons since my son is underage. This was much appreciated and worked well as we needed to be at the campus early the next morning. We chose this hotel for the location and from the other reviews it seemed that it would be walking distance to restaurants and nightlife near UCLA. The staff recommended that if we went out at night to drive or take a cab. As it turned out we were too tired and had a fabulous dinner in the hotel restaurant (a little pricey). The fitness center was well equipped. The rooms were contemporary and the beds were comfy. I do agree with one of the other reviewers that the sliding bathroom door always seemed to be ajar.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for L.A. trip”
Reviews.Author: cashmyre
Reviews.Content: Came down for a two-night stay in November, and shared a double-double room with a friend. The staff was courteous and knowledgeable; even gave us two vouchers each for free drinks at either the bar or restaurant onsite. The room was clean, the toiletries were good, and the animal-print bathrooms were a funny little touch. I had work to do in the Westwood area, but also met up with friends in BH and downtown, and the location was easy enough to get where I needed. A lot of nearby areas for dining and shopping, although not right outside your hotel. Taxis are everywhere, though, so it was easy enough to catch a quick cab somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CampHiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning and the end of a 10 night trip through California. At the end of the trip when we were rather tired, It was literally like coming home again. The staff is lovely. My mother and father who are in their 80's traveled with us and the staff was very accomodating in putting us near each other. The only reason that I did not give this hotel 5 stars is that the location, if you do not have a car and/or do not know your way around LA, is in a quiet spot that is removed from where most tourists would want to stay. But like all Kimpton hotels, once you stay in one, you know what you will get; Lovely rooms, fantastic service, and a very nice happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “again a great stay in one of the kimpton hotels”
Reviews.Author: EstherD
Reviews.Content: Since I found this "chain" of hotels, I was never disappointed. I have stayed in Washington Georgetown, in Alexandria and in LA for the second time. This time with our teenage daughter, who loved it as much as we do. The place is modern, rooms are roomy (we took the suite), and lobby is nice. The staff is very friendly and always ready with recommendations. We were recommended to have dinner at the napa valley grill. At the end of the dinner we received a plate with wonderful deserts because our hotel made the reservation for us. That was a nice touch! The room was beautifully furnished, had very comfortable beds, even the pull-out bed for our daughter was comfortable. Service from all the employees was friendly and natural. We will definitely stay here again the next time in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: NoelleAm
Reviews.Content: Location is great, service is outstanding. The coffee/tea in the AM was excellent. Cucumber water was delightful and they had strawberry water for Valentine's day. You still need a car to get around but it is centrally located. The rooms/hotel is clean, tastefully decorated and modern but not snobby. Restaurant downstairs had a delicious squash/goat cheese flatbread but if you are a picky eater, the menu would be limited, that was my friend's only complaint. Overall excellent hotel, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Non-Stuffy, but Upscale Place”
Reviews.Author: thejcar
Reviews.Content: Was here for a family member's birthday. We got a great deal on the king spa suite, which was amazing. The view over LA was gorgeous, too. The bed was super comfy, with one HUGE flatscreen in the bedroom, and another equally gigantic one in the living room/ sitting area. Pet-friendly, so we brought our doggy along, he seemed pleased too. The bathroom was just absolutely amazing, with the spa tub being even better than I expected. The decor was really awesome too, it was a great place to unwind and feel a little pampered, while not being at all fussy or cliched. Concierge service was great, and got us a great table at Wilshire (also recommended!) for dinner. The one area where I wasn't blown away was the Reception service. Everyone else seemed very nice, but my first impression was "Uh oh! Attitude alert!" This was quickly dispelled, but still, it does seem like such a cool hotel would want to put its best foot forward. I'll definitely be back. As others have mentioned, be sure to take advantage of free wine hour! So fun!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: DawnLSeattle
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, modern decor, but comfortable. The hotel is not tired at all. Excellent service. Easy check-in. Free wine hour - with good wine. We hada winter warm up special so we had two drink coupons for the bar per day. Excellent after being out all day sightseeing. Excellent workout facility - 4-5 different machine types all of which had tvs on them. Plus, big bonus was having all sorts of free hand weights. Don't normally see those in a hotel gym. Coffee bar in the lobby every morning. While there was a rather spendy valet charge of $30 per day plus tax it was really nice to have it. They were very efficient bringing the car around everyday. Big tip: if you drive a hybrid vehicle they waive the valet fees. I could have saved over $100 for our stay. The front desk clerk knocked off one day from our charge as she thought we had a hybrid (but I opened my big mouth and said we didn't). They also have the New York Times paper available every day on each floor. Not delivered to your door but very close. The location was also convenient. It is less than a mile from I-405 in Westwood which made it convenient to a lot. UCLA is right there and was a nice place to go jog one day. We had a room on the Wilshire side of the hotel - there was some noise but not distracting or noticeable. If you want more quiet pay for the LA view on the other side of the hotel. Only downside in my opinion is the breakfast menu - I felt it was somewhat limited especially on the healthy options The healthy options were rather boring. All in all this is one of my favorite hotels ever and made visiting LA super enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great service.”
Reviews.Author: kobebryantLDN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Palomar in January 2010. We checked in around 8.30pm after flying in from the UK, and were given a room on the 16th floor. As we'd booked a "vista view", having a room at the front overlook Wilshire Blvd wasn't quite what we had in mind, but after querying this with the front desk, they allocated us a room on the 19th floor with a rear view, overlooking West LA/Westwood. As many have said on here, the room was very nice - well decorated in a nice modern, contemporary style which is refreshing for a hotel chain in the US (most of which tend to be a bit boring!). Nicely cleaned and well maintaned, although slightly dusty (I've noted the comment about the slightly dated A/C, which may have been a factor). That said, when the room was cleaned on the first day, all sorted. Good quality bed linens, and nice bed. Bathroom nice size - could be bigger, but couldn't they always, eh?!? Comms provisions were very good also - free wireless internet (if you sign up as an In-Touch member, which was free!), and a 42" TV with HD broadcasts, so you can watch TV in crystal clear quality. The only downside to this was that the HD signal kept cutting out on numerous days, which I queried at the time with housekeeping, and was told it was the inclement weather causing it. Funny how it worked fine in the bar area though! (A footnote to this - I raised this issue with the staff on my return to the UK, and had a very nice response from the Hotel Manager offering his apologies and a free upgrade next time, which seems very fair). All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and assisted where possible - happily lent us umbrellas to use during our stay, as we had 5 days of torrential rainstorms! We didn't eat in the restaurant here, so cannot comment on the quality of the food, but had a drink in the bar, where the staff were attentive and professional. The location of the hotel is great - if you're not hiring a car, it's a 5-minute walk from Westwood village, with an abundance of decent restaurants, diners, bars and a couple of great cinemas. All close to UCLA, so a nice crowd and a great vibe wandering around in the evening. Not too "manic" as you would expect in LA, but still very pleasant. Getting around was also easy - close to the 405 if you drive, and not far from I-10 also. If you're on foot, the 720 Metro Rapid bus stop is only 5 mins walk also, which takes you all the way along Wilshire Blvd (Eastbound) for $1.25 - a bargain, and very quick. In the 4 days we didn't have a car (we had one for the final 2 days), getting about was much easier than we expected, so save some money, give the legs a workout and get the bus! All in all a really nice find in LA - would highly recommend it to all, and well deserving of the praise which most seem to give it.

Reviews.Title: “Best. Service. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: Liontamer
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in convenient Westwood location on Wilshire. Giant soaking tub in the "spa rooms" was great. The most important reason I'll be back, though, is the staff. 1. The front desk was really and sincerely warm and welcoming. They even remembered my name the next evening when I stopped by ask a question (and that's BEFORE I ran into car trouble). 2. My car's battery died in the Palomar garage the third night I was there (hybrids park for free), and the manager took over, handling the problem (which, with a hybrid, is not as simple as a basic jump) and even paying my cab fare out to the restaurant where I was heading. Really above-and-beyond service, provided with professionalism and a positive attitude. I travel a lot, stay in chains with great staff (Starwood, Hyatt and Hilton), and this is the the most truly hospitable and professional staffs I've ever encountered. The Palomar is my new go-to hotel when I work in LA. Also, if you join the frequent-stayer club (free) then wireless internet access is not only free, but almost seamless. A small thing, but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jlt1986
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation at Hotel Palomar because of the reviews listed here on Trip Advisor. To say the least, Hotel Palomar proved to be everything I thought it would be. I did not get a chance to enjoy the wine reception because of other activities in Los Angeles but everything else in the hotel was immaculate. The bathrooms are beautiful; the beds are very comfortable. I will definitely stay here again. They even accommodated my early check-in request and allowed me to check in two hours early. Thank you Hotel Palomar for a wonderful visit and making my first trip to Los Angeles exactly what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ted4364
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here based upon the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. The room was beautifully furnished, had very comfortable beds, and above all was very quiet in response to our request. Service from all the employees was friendly and natural - no attitudes. We will definitely stay there the next time in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: matthew_01
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been more impressed with my stay here...too many times there's a plastic feel to the hospitality one receives at hotels when traveling on business. The "my pleasure to connect you" and other tired phrases feel--and usually are--fake. Here, though, everybody I met there seemed to be good at their job and having fun doing it. We made use of their courtesy car several times and our driver was gracious and knowledgeable. The restaurant food was reliable and creative , the bartender was spot-on, and the front desk staff gamely fought through some weird glitch in their room-key system without getting rattled or rude. I think the people made the difference here. However, the rooms do deserve a mention. Are they huge? Nope. But they're stylish and immaculately clean. My bed was comfortable and the bathroom was quite nice. This was a hotel we chose on a recommendation and I'm extending that recommendation as one of my own here. Kudos to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “I've seen the future of the Kimpton brand...”
Reviews.Author: herculepoirot
Reviews.Content: Kimpton used to buy interesting, older buildings and rehab them. However, with their rapid growth the past few years they've clearly lost that vision and, in Los Angeles, rehabbed a 70's-era Communist-looking building in a decent location with rooms smaller than most in New York City. That's "the story" this hotel tells...which isn't much. In my opinion, just a bad business decision. I'm sure they also want to create a "hot scene" around the dreary pool squeezed between 2 buildings. Again, not inviting. As many have noted, the AC system is old and dusty. The room is nicely decorated but can't make up for the small size especially if you get a double room. But It's Los Angeles! One of the most expansive cities in our country. We ended up leaving two nights early and headed to the London. I hope they halt their agressive expansion and return to their roots. Otherwise, same old, same old.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding...”
Reviews.Author: mac827
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Christmas night after flying to LAX from NYC. Service was excellent all around and the property is attractive and new. We had been offered a $40 email upgrade to a spa suite. The suite was exceptional with a separate bedroom, two flat screens and a luxurious bath. Breakfast was delicious; get the Huevos Chilaquiles. Although it was chilly in LA, the outdoor pool was heated to a reasonable temp and my youngest daughter and I took a dip. No complaints at all; this was a really great choice for our stay...

Reviews.Title: “Five star service at great price!”
Reviews.Author: SophiedogsMom
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend in LA and booked the Hotel Palomar because of the glowing reviews we had read on TripAdvisor (our traveling bible!) We booked a suite as it was only an additional $50.00 per night and it was well worth it! The room was beautifully appointed and the bathroom was huge! The bedding was extremely comfortable and the room had two (yes TWO) 42" high def TV's. We also had dinner at BLVD 16. The food was quite good, but the menu was somewhat limited. I saw in previous reviews that to avoid the valet parking prices (no self-parking) that some people were finding spots on the street. FYI....the hotel has a policy that they will waive the $30/night fee if you are driving a hybrid! Fortunately we had a Prius and it saved us $60.00!

Reviews.Title: “Pet Lovers Dream-First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IloveIke
Reviews.Content: One of the top hotels in LA if you ask me - great rooms, great staff, great location, and pet friendly to boot. Have stayed here three times so far and each time hotel staff from the parking attendants to the housekeeping staff could not be nicer or more friendly. If you are traveling with a dog to the LA area stay here! They offer doggie beds and bowls and there is no surcharge at all for staying with your pet. Rooms are hip and clean and well designed - with great beds/sheets and Aveda products. I am a hard person to please and this property succeeds on all levels.....when you return from being out for the day they great you with a "welcome back" - the day we were in LA it was chilly and they had complimentary hot coco in the the lobby - free coffee in the morning as well....nice pool. Can't say enough about the place....its well run from top to bottom

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: danid09
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my fiancÃ© over the Thanksgiving holiday; we were able to get a great rate using Priceline.com. This hotel is in a great location, very trendy and very clean. You are within walking distance from Westwood Village and UCLA; there is even a small movie theater down the street. The service at this hotel is exceptional. We arrived and we promptly greeted by Valet, we didn't even have time to take our bags out of the car before they did it for us. At check-in they made us aware of all the specials they have for guests at the hotel. During 5pm - 6pm they offer free wine hour to all guests in the hotel restaurant. They also offer free coffee and tea to guests from 6a-9am. If you sign up with the Kimpton group you receive free WIFI in your room. Customer Service was wonderful, if you had any questions or concerns the hotel staff was right there to assist you. The rooms were very clean, the bathroom is nice and roomy but the door doesn't lock, it is just a sliding door. Just be aware parking $30.00 per night but unlimited ins and outs.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: dhfr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Palomar in November 2009. Like other Kimpton hotels, the decor was "funky," bordering on tacky. The staff were dressed in equally-notable uniforms. However, everyone was nice enough and generally professional. The rooms were relatively spacious and clean. I did not have any problems with insects as others mentioned. The bathroom was also very clean. I used the hotel gym as well, and it was a standard hotel gym with a few treadmills and elliptical machines. I did not try any food at the hotel restaurant so I cannot comment on that. Overall, I had a good stay and would recommend this to others. It's not exactly a bargain, so I would compare prices before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Chao_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Thanksgiving weekend. The room was great and the people there were very friendly and helpful. was able to provide hot water kettle for the room. Also a plus, parking is free if you drive a hybrid car - otherwise it's $30 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: yesnomaybe213
Reviews.Content: We spent a fabulous week at the Palomar in Westwood with our 20-something daughter, who was equally pleased with her accommodations in the room next to ours. The rooms are beautiful and well appointed, albeit in the typical eccentric Kimpton safari decor. The housekeeping staff is the BEST. From check-in to check-out we were treated like royalty by the valet staff, the front desk, the concierge, and everyone else. We were there for a family vacation and our only suggestion would be that the hotel, which primarily caters to business travelers, reconfigure some of the rooms so as to make them connecting. The location of this hotel is as good as it gets in LA: 12 minutes to the ocean (Santa Monica), 10 minutes to Beverly Hills, 2 minutes to the 405 Freeway (which you need to access the Getty Center, Catalina Ferry from Marina Del Rey, and of course LAX). Also, at the Palomar you're within walking distance of UCLA and all the great night life in Westwood. What's not nto like about that? For the money, you can't find a finer or nicer place to stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, attractive and very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: idefixaegean
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Tripadvisor and the reviews were right-on-target. The hotel is excellent: friendly and very helpful staff, great location and yes the sheets are wonderful. Breakfast staff and food were good, the evening bar quite friendly. As to parking on the back streets for those who don't want to pay $30 per night for valet... be very careful of the street signs but, yes, we found that nearby parking was possible at no cost. The location could not be better for Los Angeles..... a breeze to the 405. Attractive, friendly Westwood is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great, but Bathtub needs unclogging.. by a professional plumber.”
Reviews.Author: tiglao
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels that would accept dogs as guests :-) s a major ++! It allows people like us travel with our dear mutts. The valet service is excellent and for $30/day, it is a better choice to use it.. especially in the Westwood area with "parking permits only" on streets. A parking violation isn't worth the hassle of a free parking spot. BLVD 16 is the restaurant there. Our acommodation included the continental breakfast (for a $1.00 extra - which includes Coffee, Tea, OJ, fruit bowl and pastries). We ordered extras though. The wheat pancakes are excellent and the Eggs Benedict Florentine is okay. Kyle, our server, is SUPERB. We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast, not only for the food, but the service also. Now about the plumbing issue, I called guest services and they promptly tried a quick fix of the slow draining tub/shower. They used a plunger, and that was it. It still drains slow.. as you still shower in ankle height bathwater EEEEW!. Hopefully, they can have a professional plumber fix the problem. Overall, I would recommend it to others, with or without doggies... oh and check the bath.. just in case so you can request a room change :-) we found ours out waaay too late.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: WDW_Fam
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar exceeded our expectations from check-in to check-out. We did not have any problems with our late night check-in. The front desk staff member seemed truly happy to welcome us. Our room was quite comfortable. The bed had plenty of pillows for television watching and relaxing, and the closet space provided was more than enough for a multi day stay. The bathroom was extremely spacious. I believe our room was handicapped accessible, so that may account for the larger bathroom. If that is correct, our difficulties with the shower may not be present in all guest rooms. The shower head was situated on the long wall of the step-in shower instead of the narrow wall. This placement caused us to essentially flood the bathroom floor each morning. By the third day we knew where to position the shower head and extra towels in order to decrease the deluge. That said, it did not provide for a comfortable shower. Your room may not have this shower set up, so it may be worth it to ask at check-in. The Valet staff were always nice and retrieved our vehicle quickly. One morning we'd waited less than 5 minutes and the staff member apologized for the delay :) The Wilshire Boulevard location helped make our stay very enjoyable. UCLA is within walking distance of the Palomar. The number of quick service and sit down restaurants around campus were certainly varied for most tastes: multiple Starbucks, In-N-Out Burger, Stan's Donuts, sushi, falafel, and pizza to name a few. Access to the 405 is just down the street, and Beverly Hills and Santa Monica aren't far down the road either. We appreciated many of the free amenities provided at The Palomar. The morning coffee bar helped get us going in the morning. Free Wi-Fi in our room was a welcomed surprise. We'll visit The Palomar again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, except for the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: lasocal
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few nights while visiting UCLA and loved it. It's close enough to campus that one can walk, but they also have a shuttle van that will take you to campus if you ask the bell captain. The rooms are not particularly spacious, but are very well-appointed and classy. The staff was attentive and very friendly. I have absolutely no complaints about the hotel, and would have given five stars, were it not for the restaurant. I had eaten at Boulevard 16 soon after it opened and remember being unimpressed, but my room service meal was downright nasty. The caesar salad dressing was greasy yet flavorless, with very little cheese. The side of risotto had a pool of grease around the edge, and had a consistency more like rice pudding than risotto. I was really wishing that I would have just walked the couple of blocks to westwood - even the cheapo student eateries would have been better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sonata23
Reviews.Content: After considering many hotels in the L.A. area, we finally chose Hotel Palomar due to its location, room price and positive tripadvisor reviews. Happily, we were not at all disappointed with any aspect of the hotel. The rooms (deluxe king) were a good size, clean, and nicely decorated, the staff was very helpful and quick to respond to our questions. Paul, the Concierge, was particularly helpful and knowedgeable, and spent a lot of time with us highlighting maps, suggesting restaurants and booking reservations. We had the use of a rental car, so the location of the hotel was not an issue -- it seemed to be perfectly situated on Wilshire between downtown Hollywood and Santa Monica, which is what we were looking for. Valet parking was $30 per night with in/out privileges (pricey, but not unusual for a big city hotel). Nice touches included the complimentary tea/coffee bar in the lobby each morning, welcome cocktails, and a daily happy hour with free glasses of wine. WiFi was also free for us because I became a "Kimpton member" (like joining any hotel rewards program and easily done online), but be aware that the use of the business centre is not. We found that out while trying to print off our airline boarding passes the night before our departure. When we called the desk to inquire about charges, they told us to come to the lobby where they printed them off for us for free. All in all, Hotel Palomar proved to be a great place to stay and we would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: iknowyoulikejam
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night at the Hotel Palomar due to a business meeting I was attending at UCLA and will definitely return. The rooms are nicely appointed, nicely sized and comfortable. Every member of the staff that I encountered was helpful and seemed genuinely please to assist - something I have come to expect from Kimpton hotels. I arrived too late to partake of the complimentary wine tasting but I did eat a very tasty breakfast in the restaurant. The only drawback is that the Palomar's valet parking seems a little expensive for my tastes (you can save with a hybrid!) but it's no more expensive than comparable hotels in the area. FYI, the hotel is valet parking only. All in all, a great choice, especially if you need to be near Westwood/UCLA.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, still great!”
Reviews.Author: sanetrader
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hotel Palomar, Westwood and once again it was great! We stayed in a King Spa Suite this time and so worth it! The views from the room as well as the room itself was wonderful. Everything was clean and very tastefully decorated. The front desk staff was very accommodating with all requests. Ate breakfast only at the restaurant and it was good and not overpriced. The only thing is having to pay 30/night for parking.... the only thing that I'm not in love with. If this was lowered, even by 5/night I think I would be more comfortable with paying it. There is not a lot to do within walking distance but a lot if you have a car. We got to the Getty Center within 10 minutes for example. For the location of this hotel and the excellent staff you can be assured that my husband and I will be returning. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recco”
Reviews.Author: dan57rank
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in Oct with my wife. Staff could not have been nicer. Car valet was nice, fast and polite. Checked in and the guy said "looks like you could use a free drink" and handed us a coupon and off to the bar we went where the bar tender was eager to please with recco's for a snack. Room was very nice, comfy, very clean, excellent TV and bed with a great view looking south. Hotel was quiet, fast elevators, paper in the morning, and on and on. Would highly recco this place...great location as well. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Palomar is very clean, modern and friendly !!”
Reviews.Author: seabit
Reviews.Content: The location across Wilshire Blvd from Westwood Village and UCLA is excellent ! A couple block walk to shopping and dining! Close to Hollywood/Beverly Hills, but not as busy. Rooms were very comfortable ! Environment is fantastic !! Very friendly hotel staff, from doorperson/valet, to Restaurants waitstaff ! Pool area is very relaxing, complete with fireplace !

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff I've encountered”
Reviews.Author: MV Gal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is a nice, quiet hotel in Westwood where I stay when visiting our Los Angeles office. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms I've had so far are not large but they're comfortable. Wireless access is free, coffee in the lobby in the morning, a nice workout room and a nice pool area make it a very nice place to stay. Within walking distance are lots of shops and restaurants. They have a car available to drop you off anywhere within 3 miles of the hotel. They don't pick up. I can see I'll be making this my home away from home for my business trips from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: This place is very welcoming, but it is a bit out of the way. If you don't mind walking a half a mile to Westwood Village, where there's lots f neat eateries and walking streets, it's pretty cool. With the 20 and 720 buses, you can get by w/o a car, going along Wilshire. As for the rooms, they're very modern and well maintained. The happy hour and free wine tasting from 5-6 PM are a nice touch, as is the NYT on your floor daily, even Sunday. The pool was nice, but there wasn't much sun on the pool or chaise lounges the morning I swam. The lobby is inviting and the service is warm and helpful. If you're used to 5 stars (I'm not) this place might not cut it. But for the average Joe, it's great. And I booked it on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Convenient to UCLA”
Reviews.Author: UpstateNY621
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Palomar. We came here last year when we were college hunting for our son. We loved it's "safe" feeling and residential neighborhood flair, nestled amongst beautiful condos. Since my son did get accepted to UCLA there was not discussion as to where we'd stay before we dropped him off! It is very close and gave us a good feeling (as we stayed an extra day to vacation) that if he needed us - we were right there! The beds are so comfortable. The bathroom and room is spotless. The air is a bit noisey but you get used to it, not a big deal. We will be coming out to LA many more times in the future...so this has become our new home! The staff from valet to front desk are very friendly! We love it here! Another great feature..if you become a Kimpton member..internet is free! I'm a Marriott Awards member, and pay DAILY for the internet! NOT HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Essie16
Reviews.Content: I have had generally excellent experiences with Kimpton hotels, and the Hotel Palomar LA is no exception. Check in was friendly and efficient. My room was a bit tight in terms of size, but it included a comfortable king-size bed, chaise lounge with small side table, and full-size desk as well as an enormous flat screen HDTV.
