The bathroom was well-laid out too, although the sliding door was a bit wonky and didn't quite stay shut. There is free wifi in the room for Kimpton InTouch members. There's free coffee and tea in the lobby every morning, plus the hotel offers a decent (but pricey) breakfast menu in the restaurant. The free wine hour here is great - generous pours and the bar menu offers delicious small plates (truffle fries, flatbread pizzas, etc.) for only $3-5. One particular doorwoman (didn't catch her name) was very helpful in terms of information on how to get around. I didn't have a car but she was able to tell me the approximate cab fares to various points and options for getting to the airport. This section of LA is relatively easily walkable - UCLA, plus plenty of shops and restaurants are less than 10 minutes' walk away (including a Denny's if you want a cheap breakfast). I was only staying for a couple of days, so cabs and walking worked fine for me. But to really explore LA it's best to have a car. Parking is $30 / night, which is standard for city hotels. Street parking seemed quite restricted and I'm not sure if there are cheaper parking lots in the neighborhood, so budget extra for that cost.

Reviews.Title: “love the kimptons”
Reviews.Author: akltexas
Reviews.Content: as usual a great experience with a kimpton hotel, the chain has become our preferred choice of hotels when traveling. Great decor, staff, rooms, service , etc This is an excellent location in westwood, very close to most parts of LA and less than 20 min from LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sek86
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The room was spacious and comfortable and had a very nice contemporary decor. Bathroom was spotless (my measuring stick) and again spacious and contemporary. We didn't ask for much service, but the service that we got when we did was what one would expect from an upscale hotel. Can't comment on location as we were in town to visit family, not sight-see, but I do know it is relatively close to UCLA and Beverly Hills. We also stayed at the Washington DC Palomar in April and had a similar experience. If all Kimpton hotels are like these two, it is my new go-to "chain" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased - would recommend this hotel w/o hesitation”
Reviews.Author: LucyRic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and 3 kids. We stayed in a deluxe room which had 1 bedroom with a queen bed for us, and the kids stayed on a pullout couch and a rollaway bed in the other living room area. We were very pleased with everything from the hotel staff to the new and modern furnishings to the reasonable cost of the room. It was in a good location near Beverly Hills and Hollywood. We did some sightseeing in Hollywood, and Beverly Hills. There was a free coffee bar each morning in the lobby. Everything was classy and modern. We enjoyed our stay here very much. The inside restaurant was a little pricey, so we took the kids to a Denny's a couple of blocks away. The only negative was that they charged $30 per day to park our rental car there. They had valet service, and we agreed for the convenience, but it did add an extra cost that we did not expect. A minor negative, there was no game room, which the kids always enjoy. But, no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - could even walk to bars / restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: Well situation for LA's very spread out attractions, but likewise not really close to any of them - beach, Getty, downtown, LACMA, Hollywood, Studios are all a drive. Comfortable and well sized rooms, with a good gym - fairly large for a hotel, with lots of exercise machines. Pool outside gets the sun in the mornings and has room to 'lounge'. While we were there they had free coffee in morning and wine tasting in early evening - they have a nice bar and restaurant in the hotel as well. LA is a city where you need a car (and indeed they have valet parking) but there are actually shops and restaurants within walking distance - Westwood Village. It's a drive everywhere but that's just LA and this hotel has good road links. Â  Recommended as a good quality well placed hotel, with a pool. A solid four star hotel. Â Â

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: PoolieToronto
Reviews.Content: Great location, room, and service. We had some issues with our first room and were promptly upgraded. Overall very pleased with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “The staff must take happy pills”
Reviews.Author: vagabondCvilleva
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this Kimpton hotel [I also love the east coast Monaco, and new Lorien in the DC area] and once again I was not disappointed. I have rarely seen a hotel with staff so happy and fun! I know this sounds strange in a review but it is the truth! The valet are all smiles and jocularity and the front desk check in..esp Brandon..I may have this name wrong if so sorry..the tall very handsome African American with a smile for miles, obviously very proud of the hotel, always has something entertaining to say that makes me feel very welcome... sort of like like being at a good friend's weekend condo instead of a hotel. Check in has always been a breeze and there is just something about this place that does not feel like a hotel. I have stayed in both a suite as well as a regular guest room. The beds are extra comfy with their piles of pillows,duvets, high thread count linens, and lux bed throws. There are animal print robes [free to wear during your stay] hanging in the closet as well as socks and pjs for those who want to start their shopping early! [you can purchase everything]. Each time I have requested a room on a higher floor overlooking the more peacefull neighborhood of Westwood rather than the busier side which looks out onto Wilshire. I have always been accommodated. The views are wonderful! Now, if you have the extra cash to stay in one of their suites , it is well worth the splurge. Two nice sized rooms, flat screen tvs in both, a wet bar,stocked mini fridge, with a gigantic bathroom replete with huge soaking tub,double vanities, and a spacious walk in shower for two. It is as nice a bathroom as I have had in a hotel. As for the regular guest rooms, they are a bit on the smallish side, but that doesnt dampen the experience of their uber elegant/hip feeling of style. I also like their pool area, which, like the hotel, has a cozy feel to it with a large privacy wall,lush greenery, and a wonderful wrap around sofa that stretches out along the shaded wall. There are also abundant chaises available for those who wish to soak up the California sun. There is nothing pretentious about this place, which I really like! The location is nice. You are away from the typical touristy hustle bustle of Hollywood Blvd.and the fussy 'hoi paloi' of the Rodeo BH area. [yet you are not far if you wish to venture that way] There is the great Westwood area about three to four easy walking blocks from the hotel. It is a wonderful mix of upscale eateries,sidewalk bistros and cafes, trendy clothing stores, as well as an Urban Outfitter,a Whole Foods,movie theatres and of course the beautiful UCLA campus. I understand it is an area that has recently been refurbished. Indeed, you will still see some of the signs of the older neighborhood, a scruffy street person or two, but it has a vibrancy to it reminiscent of smaller university towns all over the country. About 2 short blocks from the hotel..hang a left as you leave the lobby, there is a great coffee shop with killer breakfasts and good lunch fare, also a good place to purchase soft drinks and snacks at far more reasonable prices than the mini bar or hotel restaurant. If there was one thing negative about this hotel, it is the restaurant,which is also where the room service food comes from. Not so great and exhorbitantly..I mean off the wall expensive!!! I dont mind paying if the quality is there but sadly they do need to revamp both their menu and prices. They were about the same as the Beverly Wislhire Four Seasons..need I say more? The hotel is such a great experience and so well run it is ashame to have to give it a low mark for the food. I will have to say that the last time we stayed there, I called for reservations thru Kimpton In Touch of which I am a member [it is free and worth joining bc you earn points with each stay that allows you to build up enough for free stays and exclusive offers], and I was given an absolutely fantastic rate [better than any other hotel chain I called like Marriott and Hilton both of which I am an honor awards point member]. Along with the reduced summer rate, we were given four free beers a night,[we stayed three nights this trip, a week last time] which we could also order from room service at no additional charge. Pretty nice even though I am a wino! They also have an afternoon wine reception in the lobby as well as coffee and tea in the mornings.[I actually saw a lady in her leopard bathrobe getting her coffee..she too must feel comfy here at this hotel!]. As we checked out, our car was brought to us right away with the usual happy nods and greetings. One of the valets noticed that my daughter's car had a white scrape on the side, which she promptly told the concerned valet, she had done herself in her apartment garage. He actually took the time to bring out a special polishing cream that immediately made the scratch disappaear..wiping at it and polishing it to a shiny new sheen! Now that is service..and as always, at the Palomar, with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many Kimptons, but this was our first time at the Palomar. Our first impression was quite negative due to the front desk staff. They seemed stressed and overwhelmed, and were borderline rude to guests. One of the receptionists, Autumn, was particularly huffy and spoke to us loudly, in very condescending tones. When we checked out, the situation was similar -- not a smile, not a "how was your stay?", nothing. They need better training in guest relations. Luckily our room was very nice. It was on the small side, but nicely appointed. We especially liked the chaise by the window. The bathroom clearly hadn't gotten much attention from housekeeping; there was a curly hair next to the sink and we were only given one bar of soap, presumably to share between the sink and the shower/tub. The drains in both the tub and sink were clogged, so we had to call maintenance to fix the issue (which they did quickly, although with no apologies from management). Some previous reviews had mentioned that the air conditioning is loud, which is true. But that actually worked in our favor. It created "white noise", masking any kind of noise from the other guests. While it's common at hotels to hear doors opening/closing, TVs, people talking in the halls, etc. -- we heard absolutely nothing and slept really well at the Palomar. Oh, and the bed was extremely comfortable, too. We got a great night's sleep. Unlike other Kimptons, they do their wine hour in the hotel bar. There's a very reasonably priced appetizer happy hour menu (in the $3-$5 range) to go along with the free wine, which is generously poured. The pool is small but has a nice decor and good music playing (not too loud). However, in the time we were there, no staff came by to pick up the towels/glasses that had been left by previous guests. So in sum, the hotel has great bones. If they can improve their staff training, they would be in great shape.

Reviews.Title: “nice funky hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: wimbledonjoshis
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, cool, nicely furnished, and in a great location. Restaraunts and shops in Westwood Village is a short stroll, beaches a 15 min drive, Getty Centre 10 mins drive and Hollywood /Beverly Hills/Universal Studios 30 mins away. Also, close to highways which makes hotel easy to get to and away from. Our room with 2 double beds easily accomodated 2 adults and 2 teenagers, plus 4 large suitcases. Beds were superbly comfortable, leading to solid sleep (a boon after a hard days sight seeing!). However, a/c can be a bit noisy, so turn it to low. Bathrooms small, but really nice - sliding door to it not an issue with good communication! Check out the streets around the hotel and no cost parking can be found to avoid the high valet parking charges. Free morning coffees and wine tasting a welcome touch. Overall, a lovely base to explore LA and surroundings. Highly recommended, particularly if a good rate can be found on the web.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff - excellent rooms and good safe location”
Reviews.Author: jad648
Reviews.Content: We chose the Palomar and found its location perfect for our needs. It is located in a nice area of Wilshire Blvd surrounded by hi-rise luxury condominiums and nearby commercial office and retail centers. Beverly Hills is a very short drive away as it's access to the I-405 freeway. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The valet parking attendants were the friendliest I've seen in a long time. The hotel lobby is a bit dark for my taste, but it is part of the decor. The room had very comfortable beds, a 42" HD LCD TV and all the amenities of a 4-star hotel. We definitely enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend it. Parking is $30 a night, but it's like that or more anywhere you go in big cities, so add it to your daily hotel budget. If you enjoy breakfast and don't want to pay $15-20 at the hotel, drive three blocks to Westwood Blvd, make a right turn and look for the Corner Bakery Cafe next to the CVS drug store on Westwood and Weyburn Ave. There are many other eateries and cafes in this area, but we liked the Corner Bakery best. This area is about 2-3 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in California”
Reviews.Author: silviahg
Reviews.Content: Nice stay in Los Angeles. Beverly Hills is a very good place to stay in this enormous city. You need a car, of course but from here you have access to all places, specially Santa Monica and the beaches!!. This hotel was nice. The building is not very luxury but rooms are very big and comfy. Bathroom very nice. We were upgraded to a suite (thank you very much!!) as it was our honeymoon and the room was superb (though the jacuzzi didn't work). The room was quiet despite of our noisy neighbors who seemed to be in a permanent party all nights. Nevertheless I enjoyed the free coffee early in the morning. The only negative things is the price of the valet parking but you have no option in the whol area. Concierge was very helpful and nice. Desk staff was not so nice and everything you asked seemed to be too much for them (I can't understand this, but anyway, maybe is the usual thing). I recommed this hotel and my stay was as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Remember when drunk people would come home and wake up the entire floor when you were in college?”
Reviews.Author: Traveller123Chicago
Reviews.Content: Overall, not a bad place to stay. The rooms are clean, the valet staff very friendly. The desk staff takes themselves a little too seriously but does try to be helpful. Unfortunately, I'm writing this having been awakened the second night in a row by drunk (and randy as they say in Britain) people coming home at 3 a.m. and then standing in the hallway to grope and argue with each other. I've called desk services twice and, although the young man there has tried to move these people along, they are still playing out their dramas in the hallway. Hold on . . . My next door neighbor has just reminded these fine young folks that they're in a hallway at 3 a.m. and the rest of us have more to do in the morning than survive a hangover. He appears to have gotten them to move into their rooms where now their dramas are muffled exchanges of stupidity rather than the blaring honks of melodrama we all had to listen to moments ago. So, the big question -- should my review hold the hotel responsible for these rude people waking everyone up for the second morning in a row? I don't know. But it's something to consider when you're trying to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique-feel, great stay, not too luxe though”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler300
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for one night and had a great time. The staff was friendly and accomodating! The rooms were nicely decorated but on the small side. The pool area was relaxing but not spacious - only a few lounge chairs. The food in the restaurant was fantastic. They had a free happy hour in the lobby which was fun! I would say this hotel is pretty, quaint, well appointed but not a full 4 star. I would stay again for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: teddy_scot
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine clean smart rooms, very comfortable. Valet Parking at $30 a night was a pain if you are in and out a lot. Westwood village a pleasant stroll away with excellent choice of restaurants. Ask hotel for a map. Valet staff were very friendly, but desk staff could smile more. It can be cool to smile. Didn't even know if they had teeth. Small pool with inadequate sun beds.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dvez
Reviews.Content: Location: 5 Stars... we were taking a tour of UCLA and the location was great. Cleanliness: 5 Stars... I found the entire property to be very clean and of high quality Service: 4 Stars... we really never asked for anything Value: 3 Stars... fairly expensive Room: 4 or maybe 3 Stars... the bathtub drain was clogged and the air conditioner was too loud to keep on at night (I couldn't sleep with the noise... bring ear plugs) My main complaints were with the noise level of the air conditioner and the water temp. of the pool (too cold). Also, they don't have a jaccuzzi. Other than that we enjoy our stay and dinner at the on-site restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Value, style,and location.”
Reviews.Author: Jact100
Reviews.Content: We booked the Palomar on Expedia and stayed a total of 6 nights: 3 at the beginning of our holiday, and 3 at the end. We were very pleased with our choice, and found the hotel to be of better value than the Westin in San Francisco (see other review), which we got for a similar rate. The location was superb, with everything on our doorstep including UCLA, Beverly Hills, Westwood village, cafes, shops, cinemas, buses, and Westwood Village Memorial Park. The area was charming and lively, while safe enough for morning jogs and late-night strolls. The staff were genuinely friendly and helpful, and guest services always responded to requests in record time.The front desk printed out directions, maps , and transport information for wherever we wanted to go. Rooms were slightly on the small side, but Wi-Fi is free, and there were large flat-screen plasma TVs in every room and Aveda products in the bathrooms. The size of the gym was also a slight disappointment for enthusiasts: clean and modern but quite small and under-equipped for 4 star hotel standards. On the plus side, it was open 24 hours. There was a small, stylish plunge pool which many not be to everyone's liking. Other guests were a healthy mix of business travellers, families, and couples : both american and international.We did not try the food, but there was free coffee provided in the lobby every morning. Overall, we would definitely stay here again, and would recommend the Palomar to anyone travelling to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pentangle
Reviews.Content: Great upscale boutique style hotel at excellent rates. Funky and quirky style. Excellent and very helpful staff. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want style maybe...if you want comfort absolutely not.”
Reviews.Author: kassie73
Reviews.Content: We went for the LA film festival and stayed in this hotel with family. We had booked 2 rooms and were sent an email from the hotel saying we could upgrade to a suite for 25$ more (since my husband's company was co-sponsering the festival). When we got to the hotel we found the rooms were rather small and facing a very ugly building and the street. We had paid for a vista room so we asked where the vista was...the answer was vista just means a higer floor. Not a pleasant view! The room was also extremely cramped and had no coffee/minibar. Then we tried to upgrade and the manager scoffed when we said we were told we could upgrade to a suite for 25$ extra a night. They said it was not possible and the hotel never does that especially at crowded times like the film festival. When my husband persisted and showed them the email we received from the hotel he reluctantly agreed to upgrade one of the rooms for 75$ extra a night. We needed the extra space to hang out and frankly were sick of waiting so we agreed. The manager of the hotel was extremely curt verging on rude and spoilt the experience for us. In the end they did not charge us for the upgrade and the suite was very nice. The rooms (even the suites) have no coffee/ no mini bar and no real value. The decor is beautiful but we will never stay there again. On a special note: Apart from the reception staff (which are a bunch of snobs), the rest of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “3 star posing as a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: MrClean69
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate at the Palomar which made me switch from my regular hotel in LA. Let me start writing by listing some of the pros and then cons. Pros: clean room, comfortable bed, good parking valets, free internet for intouch members, nice towels, coffee in lobby in the early AM (on the con side, maybe they could serve it later on weekends). Free wine hour (too bad it was Fetzer) Cons: ( all of which combined, make this hotel a 3 star) 1. Upon check-in, the valet took my bag, but not wife's. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 2. We reserved a vista deluxe room but were given a room with a view of another building (not a vista). When I asked for what I reserved, the helpful valet (not the one who took our bags) made a call and had us moved to the type of room we reserved. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 3. Looked for the concierge on 3 separate occasions, but he or she was never at their desk. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 4. Asked the front desk clerk for an LA Weekly to see what was going on in town, Her response "we don't carry it because it would be too hard to keep in stock." It is a free paper, had come out that morning, should be available for guests in a 4 star hotel. The person who made the decision to not have it available to guests seems to have missed the point that it is hard to keep in stack because guests want to use it. Also asked for a Sunday paper at 10:00 AM and desk clerk seemed to be annoyed that I didn't get my butt up at 8:00 AM so that I could ensure I got one. Gruffly went to the back office and got me a copy. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 5. Free internet for intouch members was spotty and hotel was less than helpful in troubleshooting. This could easily happen in a 4 star. 6. Location sucks if one wants to walk to breakfast. I know it is LA and everyone drives, but it would be nice to walk to coffee in the morning. In all honesty, I grew up in LA and knew the location before booking, but think that others that are not familiar should have this info. 7. No and/or poor food or drink service at the pool. Went to the pool thinking there would be poolside service. After about 20 minutes of hanging out I went to the front desk to ask about food and drink service and to ask that the used towels in the pool area be cleaned up. I was informed that there is no regular drink service at the pool, but that I could order room service and have it delivered to the pool. I asked them to send a waiter. 20 minutes later the waiter arrived. I tried to order a margarita with a specific kind of tequila, but the waiter wasn't sure if they had it. I offered him three different options and asked him to bring me one of the 3 options. 15 minutes later he arrived not with my drink, but with a list of the tequilas they did have and then asked me what kind I wanted in my "mojito" At that point I cut my losses, informing the waiter that mojitos are not made with tequila, that I had wanted a margarita, and that it I no longer wanted anything because I had little faith that my drink would be correct or in my hand in any reasonable amount of time. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 8. Upon check out, valet once again took my bag but not my wife's. I am 6'4" and 230 pounds, my wife is 5'7 and 135 pounds. Who do you think needed help with their bag? This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. All in all, this hotel looks like a 4 star, but IMO the difference between a 3 and 4 star hotel are in the details, which the staff and management of the Palomar have neglected. I might stay here again if I got another incredibly low rate like the one I received for this stay, but my expectations will be severely lowered next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Clean Hotel - Like New”
Reviews.Author: c1033
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our kids. My parents also travelled with us and had their own room. I was quite pleased with this hotel. Although we did not spend much time in the public areas of the hotel, at first glance, everything was very modern and new looking. The staff was great to deal with. They were extremely friendly and helpful. The front desk was helpful in providing directions to various places and answering any questions we had. The room was like new and kept nice and clean. There were no signs of wear on the carpet/walls, etc. Travelling with small kids that touch everything, I was quite pleased to say that the housekeeper did a great job each day. We asked for adjoining rooms and the front desk easily accomodated our request. The only downside to the room was that the washroom door did not have a lock - but this wasn't a big deal. We stayed facing Wilshire Blvd. and have no complaints with noise. I believe we stayed on the 8th floor. Each morning they offered coffee. It was nice to grab a cup of coffee on our way out. Each evening they offerred a complimentary glass of wine at their bar/restaurant. There is street parking up front, but it's impossible to find. The side streets have parking but I believe you have to move your car by 7am. Parking at $30/day added up! That is my only complaint. Having said that, many of the hotels I looked in to charged around this much for parking as well. Overall, I would definately come back and stay at this hotel. The staff were great and the hotel was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benchmarktravel
Reviews.Content: I had 10 days of meetings in Beverly Hills and stayed at the Palomar. This hotel was simply the Best Experience I have had at a hotel - at any price. Fantastic Service, Food and the Bar were top notch (great music), rooms (although small) were very clean, excellent beds, great sheets and a Large Flat screen TV. Staff was extremely friendly and efficient. Complaints? I wish the TV was a bit faster to change channels or had a guide system on it. Parking is Valet only at $30 a night. Tip: Ask for a room on the South SIde of the hotel - Wilshire Blvd can be noisy. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are checking out UCLA, this is where you should stay”
Reviews.Author: balansandiego
Reviews.Content: I was in LA to look at UCLA with my son. The hotel is walking distance to everything. It is chic, modern and the service is 5-star. They can't do enough for you. The value is awesome because the rate was pretty low for what we received. The beds were very comfortable. The only glitch was there was something wrong with movies on demand but they refunded the cost of the movie and I received a personal email about it, imagine that! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton great as always”
Reviews.Author: midatlantictraveler1
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm a little late writing this, since we stayed in December, but I have good memories of my stay here, so decided to write a review. This hotel lives up to the Kimpton brand, which is my family's choice whenever we stay someplace that has one. Our room was spotlessly clean, had a nice view, and HUGE bathroom. It was a 1 BR king suite. Everything in the room was typical of a Kimpton hotel, very stylish and whimsical... The bathroom was OPEN to the bedroom, so if this is not something you're entirely comfortable with, just be mindful... my wife and I were fine with it though. Wine hour was very nice and classy in the lobby. They did not have a selection of bottled beer as the Kimpton Hotel Marlowe in Cambridge, MA has (another great hotel) -- this would be a great touch for the non-wine drinkers in the crowd. Restaurant was good, we ate there one night and were impressed with the food and service. My only gripe would be the charge for mandatory valet parking. I realize this hotel charges virtually the same rate as every other hotel in the area, so it's not really a ding on them. More on the fact that you have an area of the city that is pretty much unwalkable (but where in LA really is walkable?), where you're required to have a car, and yet you have to pay an exorbitant fee for parking... but I digress. It's a great place to stay, comfortable, with typical Kimpton class. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy we picked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarryNYC
Reviews.Content: I don't usually do online reviews, but I try to do it when a hotel has been exceptionally good. This was one of those experiences. The staff was consistently above-and-beyond, the hotel was cool-looking, they did little things like have the New York Times available, the free wine hour in the afternoons was nice, etc. There were even free popsicles in the lobby on a hot afternoon -- a nice touch. The location was wonderful (about 15 minutes walking distance to Westwood Village, but more importantly "centrally located" in LA so that the beach, downtown, LAX, whatever, all feel accessible). Yes, the pool area is small and shady, but truthfully I found it relaxing and cozy. The only other possible downside is the $30/day parking fee (but that's LA, and maybe everyone should just think of it as part of the room fee; in our case, we were willing to spend the 5-10 extra minutes finding on-street parking -- which we were able to do on all 4 nights of our stay with little inconvenience -- and thus saved the $). For us, this hotel was a "find" (especially for the price) and we'd come back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcohn
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and in a good location. Two small complaints, but overall I'd stay there again. The first complaint was the pool. It's small and at the back of the hotel. Seating is limited and so are the towels. The pool is in the shade of the hotel all afternoon (and perhaps morning, we only went in the afternoon). The seating is in the sun for part of the afternoon, but it was hard to find a seat and the pool was cold - had it been in the sun it might have been warmer. The second complaint, was the actual size of the room. My husband worked at the desk on his computer checking email and such and the back of the chair almost hit our king size bed. If he was sitting down, I couldn't negotiate to the other side of the room without climbing over the bed - not what I expect at a Kimpton hotel. Other than that the hotel was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice property in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: I read up on tripadvisor and did my research and was able to book a low rate a few months ago. When i was able to find a lower rate I contacted the manager Stephen and he was able to provide a price match for the lower rate. Stephen was very helpful with my reservation, I appreciated his attentiveness! We arrive around 2pm saturday and score a perfect parking spot right in front of the hotel, so we dont have to pay the $32 for valet parking! We go to our room which winds up being #1618 and its next to the ice machine and very close to the elevator. Try to ask for a room away from the elevators, as the "ding ding" noise when it stops on the floor is loud enough to hear in the room. It woke me up a couple of times and i thought it was an alien spaceship lol. Wine hour was not in the lobby/living room like all the other kimpton properties I have patroned, but instead in the restaurant. So we enter and head to grab some Sangria and then the guy serving snobbishly asks us for our room keys! I pull it out and show him and he pours us some Sangria. Lo and behold, as more guests arrive, NONE of them are asked for their room key. I'd hate to think it was due to our age or our race, but LA is known to be snobby and stuck up, and I could expect this at Les Deux but not at a hotel! Restaurant had a happy hour for appetizers so we ordered some sliders and calimari, which were both very good. I would try a meal at the Blvd 16 restaurant if we come back. Checked out the pool area and its really small, so dont have high expectations coming in. Room was pretty nice, TV had lots of channels, was able to catch a boxing match on HBO and the nba playoff game. The View was nice, we were on 16th floor so you could see a ways a way. Only 2 minor issues in that it took a week or so for the difference in the lower rate to be applied to my credit card and a few days after check out I checked my statement and I had been billed for something from the bar. We did not take anything from the honor bar, and so had to call the property. Josue said he would take away the charge, but 2 weeks later, it was still there, so I had to call accounting and leave a voicemail, which has yet to be returned. Hopefully it will get taken care of shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in LA”
Reviews.Author: Bertha_Brown
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotwire through the mystery hotel option (for a really great rate) and after reading some of the reviews on this site I was a little worried about staying there but I shouldn't have worried. Hotel Palomar is a great hotel and a great base for a stay in LA. To the reviewers who said that it was so far away from everything - what do you mean by everything? It is very close to the airport, a short drive to Hollywood/Beverly Hills etc., a slightly longer drive to the beaches - where else do you want to go? We walked everyday into the Westwood neighbourhood for great food/drinks and we also saw the opening of the Transformers movie and a concert by Lincoln Park all walking distance from our hotel. To the reviewers who complained about parking costs - this is LA - it costs money to park at every hotel, restaurant etc. - just get used to it. We also got a discount on the valet parking because we hired a Prius which was nice. To the reviewers who complained about the service - maybe you were rude and did not get the best service possible as we did, especially the lovely smiley valet parking attendants - they were so friendly and helpful and very sweet with our children. Our kids loved the pool and we had a quiet room with a great view. So if you are reading all of the reviews below and getting worried, I would say that those people who were so negative about the Palomar probably have a bad time everywhere they go. It is great. And free wireless broadband - who doesn't like that?

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel that was a super value”
Reviews.Author: SLYCAST
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kimpton Hotel Palomar over the recent Memorial Day Weekend. We chose this hotel for its location close to Westwood, the UCLA campus and Beverly Hills and also because of the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor. This property is located on Wilshire Blvd. and sits among several high-rise residential properties. However, once you enter into the lobby, you would never know that you are on such a busy thoroughfare. During our stay, there were a few hiccups with the valet parking because we had to wait in line for the valet to take our car whenever we returned from our daily excursions. But even so, I must say that this is one of the few hotels (outside of NYC) that I have visited that seem to have a sufficient valet staff; our car was always waiting for us when we called down before heading downstairs. Our room was somewhat on the small size, but it was nicely decorated and was equipped with an acceptable flat panel HD TV, and an AC unit that kept the room cool during the heat of the day â€“ that was a first for us. Other than that, the room was clean, comfortable and the housekeeping staff was superb. We initially had a few problems with the free wireless but that problem was quickly solved. I booked our room through Expedia and got a very nice rate for this grade of hotel, and I am glad to say that this hotel greatly exceeded my expectations. Sadly, we were never able to take advantage of the complimentary wine in the hotel bar nor did we check out the pool. Every member of the staff was professional and gracious and made us feel so welcome. We did have a rental car and if you stay at this hotel, you must have one if you plan on seeing the sights in L.A. This is a fabulous hotel if you would like to avoid the tourist crowds and you are not averse to exploring the local neighborhood on foot. We stayed for 3 days and were able to find an amazingly broad selection of restaurants and bars that were a short walk away in Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Way Overpriced Parking”
Reviews.Author: synthesis
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel in an excellent location. We stayed here for four nights and had very few complaints. The staff treated us well. The decor was beautiful. The beds were very comfortable with terrific sheets. The TV was excellent. The rooms were well maintained and very clean. Happy Hour was fun (though not the best wines in the world). They have fresh coffee and tea in the morning available in the lobby. Try for an upper floor facing the south. if you're facing Wilshire Blvd., you will hear the traffic noise no matter how high up your room. The exercise room is tricked out with lots of brand new whiz-bang machines. The pool is very small as is the entire pool area. There is an outdoor fireplace in the pool area which is a nice touch. BTW, Boulevard 16, the restaurant in the hotel is excellent. Very nicely prepared food, but not too precious. *Major Complaint: This has already been voiced by other reviewers--the cost of parking. It is the only option available and is ridiculously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “My friends are no longer after this stay”
Reviews.Author: RichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been all over the world and always stay in 4 star or better. I am a fan of this hotel group in DC , but my gosh what were they thinking and who runs this place? Service was not only poor , made me wait for an hour for a call back , when i asked them why the water was brown, eww!!, and my adjacent room for my friends as well. They took a bath and she screamed when it was full of brown and soot. eww!! i swore that it was my fault, but then after waiting the hour, i realized that they did not care, so i walked down, they said " we are busy now with other guests please leave the lobby area", yeah right!! i freaked out, they said "do you have a room with us? " i said, two actually , two suites at that!! the room service taste like they found the food out back in the garbage and re-served it to me... i always take blame when others are upset, with my friends that is, but this time , i demanded my money back.... they offered me another night stay, i declined and checked out, took them all to another location. Reputation and respect mean everything in the business that i am in. It should be in theirs too!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience EVER... BEWARE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: love2go_9
Reviews.Content: The rate for our room was good, parking was very overpriced, front desk staff very unfriendly but get the job done. The only two good things about this hotel are the room decor and the fact that they allow dogs. However my boyfriend and I travel almost monthly all over the country, Vegas, Miami, New York...etc... and this was the worst experience we have ever had. Our room/ tax/parking came out to about $180. A day later there was a $400 charge on our card on top of the $180, so $580 for a one night stay. When we called the hotel after spending 5 days tracking down an answer, I finally got a reply that housekeeping had reported that the room smelled of smoke, so we had a $400 smoking charge. We were there for one night for a funeral/memorial service, and neither my boyfriend nor I smoked in he room at any point plus we are non-smokers in general so would not smell of smoke. The assistant general manager Stefan refused to reverse the charge so now we are taking it up with our credit card company. We are both attorneys down in San Diego and are not going to let this one go! It is credit card fraud!!! Please heed my advice and avoid this hotel at all costs By the way my whole family lives in LA and I grew up there so I visit about once a month and was so happy to find a hotel where I could bring my dog, they just lost a potentially regular customer!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain at $89.00”
Reviews.Author: bennyboyHouston
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain about this hotel. Great rate, room nice. Parking and food expensive but that is to be expected since the rates are so cheap. Rooms nice, not large. I do agree with the street noise though and it is a bit of a trek to find things to do close by. I would stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Property with Excellent Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: azjeans
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar in Westwood for two nights over Memorial Day weekend. Upon arrival, we were greeted at the valet by a friendly bellhop who took our luggage inside. Check-in was quick and the clerk was friendly and offered helpful information, tips and suggestions. In fact, all employees we encountered at the hotel were very friendly. Our room was on the 12th floor with good views overlooking the city. The room was an average size. The bed was comfortable and the room was spotless. I liked the contemporary dÃ©cor. The bathroom was a good size and they had nice bath products. There were also several magazines to read in the room as well as the complimentary NY Times available. My only complaint about the room is that at times the walls seemed a little thin. We headed downstairs for the complimentary wine hour. It was the beginning of the Kimpton summer promotion that has summer cocktails and Wii games. We had some wine and sangria and played Wii bowling while munching on cheese and olives. Though we didnâ€™t try the appetizers while we were at the restaurant because we had dinner plans, they looked very good and their happy hour prices were quite reasonable for a property of this caliber. Free tea and coffee was also available in the lobby each morning. As far as the surrounding area goes, we didnâ€™t spend much time there, but it was very nice and there was stuff to do nearby. The pool at the hotel also looked inviting and there was a small fitness and business center on the 6th floor. Overall, I really enjoyed our stay at this property and would stay again. It was easy to find, the staff was excellent, and the property was comfortable and clean. Thank you Hotel Palomar for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: alohatripper
Reviews.Content: May 13, 2009 We had to stay overnight in LA or Chicago because a return air trip from Rome to Honolulu was not possible in one day. We were glad were chose Palomar near Westwood Village and UCLA. We booked this room through a bid on Priceline. We didn't expect to receive such a large, superior room for the price. The location is just a block or so from Westwood. I found parking on the street but be watchful for street cleaning days. Inside, the decor is ultra-modern and sleek. When I saw the animal print robes in the closet, I thought the previous guest had forgotten to remove the items. I did not try the hotel restaurant. We did enjoy the complimentary continental breakfast. Early coffee/tea service were available in the lobby during the morning. Every staff member I met, including the hotel manager, were very professional and eager to be of service. When I return to LA, I will book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in great West LA location”
Reviews.Author: BjornCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Your typical boutique property in a large urban area. Modern design, but some of the switches and devices were odd to operate. By the his & hers animal print wear in the closet (robes and undies), they expect you to have a wild time, alas I was by myself. The rooms are a bit small, but the gym was nice and the wine receptions just super!. A short walk to many nearby restaurants. Only had breakfast in the restaurant (old fashion American fare), but the service was superb!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: tassy3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for 7 nights during our trip to LA. We'd been to LA before so had a reasonable idea of what to expect about the hotel's location and local amenities. We walked everyday into Westwood village. It was a pleasant five to ten minute walk, and our kids did it easily and without complaint. Westwood has everything you need. and we had good access with our car to all of LA. The hotel is stylish but without being overbearing. We felt comfortable there. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room on the top floor overlooked Wilshire Blvd. There is some traffic noise but nothing unbearable. After all, it's LA. In room facilities were good. With kids in tow, we kept the mini bar locked. Restaurant prices were reasonable. The happy hour with free wine between 5 and 6pm was a nice touch. The only downside is the valet parking charge. But as we got a really good nightly rate for our rooms, by the time we added valet we were still in front of other comparable properties in the area. The pool area is great. Some reviewers have commented that it is only big enough for 'five or six people'. Don't know how big those people were, but the pool was ample for our kids and others to have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: Roadroute
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire and got a great rate however there are so many hidden charges. Parking, valet only, tips everytime you need your car, Internet and the food is outrageously priced and it is not located near any other restaurants. The location is not that great, near UCLA but everything else is a drive. It took us an hour to get to Hollywood. Rooms are very small and the hotel did not feel clean. Smelled of cigarette smoke and there is no fresh air, windows do not open. The street noise is very bad. If you just want a cheap rate book it on Hotwire. Another reviewer mentioned the pool. We went out there and there is no room for more then 6-8 people and the neighbors behind the hotel look down on the pool area. Not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: cubuff1453
Reviews.Content: Booked a king spa suite for a weekend getaway with the girlfriend, and it was about perfect. Valet and front desk staff were all smiles and very helpful. The room was better than expected. Big, very clean, full of amenities, stylish, super comfortable bed, and the fuji soak tub rocks! The hotel has a great feel and style to it. The location was just fine, not sure what some other reviewers were expecting? LA is a very spread out destination, and the Hotel Palomar provides a nice central location. Close to Hollywood, Santa Monica, Beverly Hills, Griffith park, UCLA, etc. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but not in style”
Reviews.Author: GraceyBill
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel bases on reviews. The location is not very good. It is about a mile to any restaurants or activities. Restaurant and room service very expensive, the restaurant was not open for lunch. I think that was a good thing with the prices. The pool was ridicilous. Holds maybe five people. The biggest disappointment was the room size. They are so small, hardly largr enough for one, certainly not for a family. We only paid $100 a night on Hotwire and it was not worth anymore. Oh yes, be careful of the air conditioner and street noise. They advertise free internet yet charge for the business center. Staff was OK, thirty dollars to park though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent boutique hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: misterbitterpants
Reviews.Content: Company booked the room for me and it was pleasant enough. Modern design with some nice design touches although the common area lighting is a little too 'moody' (aka dark). Nicely sized rooms for my tastes, well kept and the staff are very polite and helpful. Nice touches include: - free wireless with a strong signal (still a rarity at higher priced hotels for some reason). - Aveda bath products - LCD tvs with actual HD feeds - iPod docking alarm clock Some minor things: - windows don't open - $40 cab ride from airport - no bar scene unlike many boutique hotels Fatal flaw: - loud HVAC

Reviews.Title: “Classic Kimpton modern style comes to Westwood”
Reviews.Author: kg32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Palomar just two weeks after the doors opened. The way that the staff attended to the property and guests was more in line with a hotel that has been open for many years. As with other newer Kimpton properties, The Palomar is elegantly decorated with a warm, yet modern lobby and restaurants. The daily 5pm Happy Hour is a great way to transition to the evening. Our room was a corner King suite overlooking south Westwood. The sitting area was roomy and comfortable and the bedroom and bathroom were top notch with a jet tub, colorful leopard print robes and premium bath products. While the W is the established name in Westwood, The Palomar will be the place that I'll be staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Luxury right at Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: atallxmaui
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found a super great price on Travlezoo for this hotel and am I glad I jumped on it! The Palomar is very upscale and contemporary in decor. The room was small but we were only there for 1 night. We were on a top floor so the view was spectacular! The furnishings are very hip and art deco as is the lobby. We were met by a great staff who were very helpful in getting us to all the typical Hollywood and Beverly Hills sites. Valet parking was easy and seamless and everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. The mini-bar was the best stashed bar I have ever seen, I felt like a kid in a candy store. However, it was good for looking but the prices were high! We went to Santa Monica Pier that evening and had the best time walking the pier and playing in the arcade. It was very cool that evening but that did not deter the locals from venturing out into the dark ocean. It was really a spectacular place and worth the money. The linens were so-o-o soft and the bed was very comfortable!! This is a great location for the Beverly Hills/Hollywood traveler.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel leaves something to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: vince_q
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year and had a wonderful experience, and it ran like a well-oiled machine. The service/staff was excellent. This month, I returned only to discover the complete opposite. I don't know if this hotel is under new management or what, but it certainly isn't up to par with my previous visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TanyaLithonia_Ga
Reviews.Content: We had a great spring break in LA. The hotel was very nice, clean, and the service was excellent. The only thing was that the rooms were small. The double beds were too small for me. Next time I would consider a suite for the four of us, my husband, twin teens and myself. But, other than that, no complaints with this hotel. Service was excellent, they required $30.00 a night for valet, but that was ok, because they were so fast and courteous. Housekeeping kept the rooms clean like I like it, if we asked for extra towels, they were they in a flash. We ate at the Blvd Restaurant for breakfast one morning...so good. The hotel offers coffee and tea in the morning, which was good. The location of the hotel was good...we did Universal, Starline Tours, shopping on Rodeo Dr, we ate at the Farmers Market and shopped at the Grove and Beverly Hills. We also drove to Malibu and had dinner at this restaurant called Geoffrey's..goood! And oh, we took the kids to the Tarpit Museum very educational. So as you can see we had a very nice "spring break", we will return to Los Angeles and stay at the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but far from things to do”
Reviews.Author: cami1978
Reviews.Content: The rooms were up to Kimpton standards -- very nice. The service was great, too. The room service was ridiculously expensive, and the restaurant closed that evening for a private event. So we bought cheese and wine from a nearby Trader Joe's. The bed was very comfortable. The coffee in the lobby in the morning was very good. The hotel was off the beaten path. Cabs to Hollywood were $30 and 30 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: startakovsky
Reviews.Content: Great experience; everything from room service to offering local rides in their Lexus, the Palomar experience is unprecedented and highly recommended. Rates are great too, though their compensated by my employer. One point of improvement is the raw food at the Blvd 16; the oysters were not great, but then again who gets oysters at a non-seafood restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel like LA”
Reviews.Author: rollwaverollnyc
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel b/c of the location, close to my work. They just opened. Some wrinkles needed to be ironed out, they reacted quickly and professionally whenever an issue arose.I stayed many times over many mths. The hotel was completely renovated so everything was clean clean clean. Much appreciated that. The fitness center was great and often on the empty side. The restaurant/room service never left me hungry. I had one of the best halibut dishes there. The hotel company has a "green" awareness which is also appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience - EVER”
Reviews.Author: glsandrews1359
Reviews.Content: I travel about 25+ times a year for business and personal travel. My stay at the LA Kimpton Palomar was, by far, the best experience I have ever had. EVERY one of the staff we encountered during our 4-day trip was extra helpful, accomodating, friendly. The digs are ultra cool. My 14-year old daugther felt like a movie start. It also helped that the weekend we were staying, the hotel hosted a streaming media industry event. The vibe in the hotel was hot, hip, happening, vibrant. I could have felt old and out of place, but the staff never let me feel that way. The beds are a dream, the room was ultra quiet. We also found a great rate that included parking (a must for this hotel, where your only option is valet hotel parking). The location of the hotel was the best in LA. It was central to everything - the beaches, the nightlife, the sightseeing, the shopping. Yet, each night, we returned to a mellow, safe neighborhood to relax in our great room. Great job Palomar! I will definitely pick your hotels from now on when I travel. Hilton who??

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except for one small issue”
Reviews.Author: RedPatch
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with three co-workers while attending a class held by UCLA. It was for a two night stay. I found the accommodations to be extremely nice. The room was clean, the facility well kept, and the staff polite and helpful. You had your usual city noise that one would expect, but other than that, nothing more. The location was wonderful for us as our class was held just blocks away and within walking distance. The parking we used was valet, and we found them to be quick and courteous at all times. A Continental breakfast was included each day that consisted of juice, coffee, tea, a choice of bread and a pastry item. This was served at their onsite restaurant, which we did not have time to visit during lunch or dinner service. My only problem came with some missing cash that I had left in my luggage in the closet. I reported this to the front desk and mentioned to them that my door also had a problem with not shutting tightly and it required some extra tugging and jiggling. I doubt that the staff had anything to do with this, and most likely, after it had been cleaned the door probably hadnâ€™t shut tightly and someone had taken advantage of that. They assured me they had never had this happen before and would have someone look at the door the next day. In retrospect, I should have placed my cash in the safe, but in all of my years of travel this was a first. I was grateful it was a small amount. I checked out the next morning, but hopefully, the door was indeed fixed. Also, I checked the credit card account I had used for this hotel a few days later and found a charge on it. When I called I was told it was for an item from the mini-bar. I informed them I hadnâ€™t even received the key for the mini-bar and they told me it would be removed and it was. They were very gracious and apologetic. I mention this only so that you check your account after you leave to make sure you havenâ€™t been mistakenly charged for something as well. Overall, I would stay here again. I have to give the hotel a four only because of the incidents I encountered, but it is a wonderful property otherwise. Also, if you are looking for a great place to eat , â€œThe Lobsterâ€� down by the Santa Monica Pier area is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars,”
Reviews.Author: Traveleronthemove
Reviews.Content: My wife picked this hotel based on the reviews. The service is so bad. Room noisy,asked three times to move no one ever responded to our request. Like the previous traveler we did not pay $109 per night, we paid $289 per night and really feel shafted. Parking $30, Breakfast for two $50. Service was so slow, they seemed understaffed everywhere. I can understand that however no apologies were offered, could not sleep because of traffic noise. Rooms very small, amenities seem to be lacking. No lotion or shampoo in room, had to call several times. We went to UCLA for lunch with our daughter and out for the dat. We returned at 4:00 PM. Room still dirty. Asked for manager at check out. Guest what only a supervisor on duty and he offered nothing, not even an apology. We travel to LA quite often and will never stay at this hotel again. It is a rip-off. I cannot believe UCLA would recommend this hotel. Room service that is a whole other story. It is the most expensive room service ever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel shame about the air-con unit.”
Reviews.Author: tellsitlikeitisSpain
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel after a disasterous stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt. Westwood is a lovely place much nicer than Hollywood. The Hotel staff were all very friendly, the room was lovely and spotless clean very nice decor. We used the hotel bar several times and the staff were really friendly and good company, the restaurant served fabulous food and had a great atmosphere. There are nice restaurants and bars which are quite a walk away but they provide a house car upto a certain distance, we also caught the end of a premier (which we were told happens regularly in Westwood) and the cast of Pineapple Express were supposed have stayed in the very same hotel the night before we checked in Typical! The only problem was that the air-con unit in the room was very noiser whilst it was reaching a certain temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - management went out of its way to ensure a great visit”
Reviews.Author: JoshLondon62
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Kimptom Hotels (Hotel Monaco in Denver and Salt Lake City, Sky Hotel in Aspen and Hotel Palomar in San Francisco) and my stay at this property did not disappoint. The room was great - the photos on the hotel web site accurately reflect their look. Overall the feel is stylish, but does not suffer from the forced trendiness or terminal hipness of many boutique hotels. I particularly liked the big-screen LCD TV, choice of cable channels, bathrobes, L'Occitaine bath products, bed linens, lighting with dimmers and the view from my "Vista" room. High-speed wireless internet was free and download speeds were pretty good. The lamps take some getting used to; touch or tap them to turn them on or increase their brightness. There were some minor service issues which were resolved quickly and efficiently by management. There was a water main break during my stay which didn't cause much of a disturbance beyond a brief alarm in the middle of the night. This was clearly beyond the hotel's control, however. Room service was prompt and the food was very good. Valet parking, at $30 a night, is pricey but in line with hotels in the area. I came and went as I pleased and never waited for my car to come around - I usually called a few minutes in advance. The staff was great all around - the housekeeper who serviced my room was particularly eager to help. She and her team worked around my schedule to look after the room. So despite one or two bumps, I had a great stay and would recommend the hotel to those who like to add a bit of style and fun to their travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DelmarSam
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar was very conveniently located for us as we toured. It was a great launching point for our travel in all directions, to Studio City, the Getty Center and beyond, Beverly Hills, Hollywood and Malibu. The service was exceptional and I have never encountered a more polite and friendly staff. The manager went out of his way to help me by scanning and e-mailing an important document to my daughter. In fact we were just blown away by the customer service orientation of the hotel which I suspect is reflective of the Kimpton chain. Among the nice perks were our choice of newspapers and complimentary wine service in the lobby each evening. The parking is a bit pricey, but I guess that is par for the course in a major city hotel. The parking staff was very quick in retrieving our car.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and fun”
Reviews.Author: northsoutheastwest
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at the Palomar. The rooms are wonderfully decorated with contemporary furnishings , animal prints, and faux fur throws. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the linens soft. Although the rooms are not huge, they are well designed and have ample rooms. The shower was great, and L'Occident En Provence products wer very nice, espcially the wonderful soap. We had a great view facing south to the Pacific in the distance with the impressive Mormon Temple in the foreground . Hotel Staff were very friendly and accomodating. The wine service in the evening was a great way to wind down in the afternoon, and morning coffee and tea was a nice touch. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was delicious and innovative. An added bonus to staying here is the close proximity to UCLA, Century City, The Getty and the Hammer. Also, ithe Westwood location allows you the luxury of actually walking to dining and attractions. It's nice to experience Ls Angeles as something other than a long Freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Highley Recommend on Every Level”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms - also recommend upgrading to suite with hot tub. (Ask for one Brad Pitt has stayed in.) Convenient location to freeways, shops and restaurants, etc. Got work done but also made time to use great amenities throughout - dining room, gym, pool and wonderful bar area. Just an overall ten!

Reviews.Title: “Above the Stars, by far, it's at the Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: garydijr
Reviews.Content: When I travel with my family, I demand top grade service to insure my families comfort. The Hotel Palomar LA far exceeded my expectations. The staff is warm and greeted us with smiles, My kids were comfortable with the staff, never a delay when something came up that we needed to make our stay as plesant as possible. I want to say thank you, A BIG THANK YOU, to the management and staff at Hotel Palomar LA, We will only be staying at this hotel when we visit the Los Angeles/Westwood area. Thank you again, it was by far one of my best hotel expierences I have ever had, and I am a very VERY AVID travler. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in the city of Angels”
Reviews.Author: nyroady
Reviews.Content: Great new Kimpton Hotel in the Westwood area of Los Angeles. The lobby area gives you an immediate sense of style in this hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and quick to address any needs. The guest room was really nice. We had upgraded to a spa suite and it was really a cool room. It offered a huge bathroom and amazing spa tub. The room and furniture were really comfortable and had lots of style. I wish I had some of the pieces in my own home. I brought my laptop and the suite had a great work desk and the internet connection worked easily. They did a wine hour each night so that was very enjoyable to grab a glass of wine on our way up before dinner. It has a great location on Wilshire not far from the 405 so our access to West Hollywood and Santa Monica was just minutes in each direction. We did have dinner in the restaurant one night. I ordered the Orchiette Pasta with Wild Mushrooms and it was fantastic. They had a pool but it was cooler out when we were there so never got a chance to check it out. All in all, it was a great experience and I would highly recommend the Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: This property is well-located, or as well-located as you can be in sprawling Los Angeles. It is about a 10-15 minute drive to Santa Monica, a 7-10 minute drive to Beverly Hills, 15 minutes to the airport and a 10 minute walk to Westwood Village, with its myriad of inexpensive dining options. The rooms are typical Kimpton--large LCD TV, relatively comfortable bedding and an intentionally kitschy aesthetic (i.e., lots of animal prints and bold colors). The room itself is not overly spacious, but it had a nice-sized closet. The bathrooms are fine, with a combined tub/shower and one sink. The vanity had plenty of room and the hotel was generous with the small bottles of L'Occitane toiletries. The gym has a nice selection of cardio machines and each machine has its own TV. The gym, however, lacks sufficient weight equipment, but, overall, the gym is clean and feels very new. We did not have the chance to use the pool, even though it was in the 80s during our stay, but the pool area seemed nice, though I am not sure how much sun it received. This is a nice hotel that fits the mold of other Kimpton properties. If you like that feel, you'll like this hotel. If you can find a good deal like we did, then this hotel is that much better for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bjo616
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent from the rooms to the hotel staff. The rooms were spacious, clean and well decorated. The location was very convenient to Beverly Hills, Malibu and downtown Santa Monica. The hotel made great dinner recommendations for us on Friday and Saturday night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel and a good value. Location is utilitarian.”
Reviews.Author: Modern_Art_Lover
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Helpful staff. Snazzy decor and furnishings. And the wine every evening was a nice touch -- and good for business socializing. The restaurant food was delicious but inattentive with very long waits, even when told we're in a hurry. The bell staff, tending to luggage and parking, was wonderfully hospitable and efficient. This location was convenient for my business purposes -- and in L.A., roadway geography is key. But there's not much for half a mile around except for Manhattan-style apartment buildings and busy Wilshire Blvd. But a walk over to Westwood Village brings life back to the environs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar-Westwood is as good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: wsbull57
Reviews.Content: I have always been a big fan of Kimpton Hotels but the Hotel Palomar-Westwood exceeded even my already high expectations. The physical structure is stunning, the rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable, the restaurant is amazing, but it is the staff here that really puts this property over the top. I travel for a living and I consider where I stay as my home away from home. Well if it were possible I would like for the Hotel Palomar-Westwood to become my permanent home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: friofrio
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is a nice hotel. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is well laid out. The complimentary afternoon wine and morning coffee are a nice touch. I ate dinner at the bar and the food was delicious and nicely presented. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Didn't use the pool, but it looked very nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: lebyvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night , we thought we will try it first and if we felt comfortable we can extend our stay for three more nights. It's not the first time to stay at kimpton hotels , the one in portland is awesome . When we arrived , three guys welcomed us , they jump all around u and ofcourse they are expecting tips ,one opened the door one opened the other door and someone else to took care of luggage , YES it's nice but a little bit too much . as we r payin 30 $ already for parking . I think one guy for parking is more than enough. the room is nice on the 15th floor, tons of dust(I a not usually a complainer) but the dust so obvious to ignore. Now at night ,first I heard a knock on my door , i openned to find out that it's not my door but our neighbours, requesting some service , that happened 3 times , the last one was around 11 00 pm. Thank God we were so tired that we ignored the noise (I am not sure if there is a bar or soemthing there ) We loved the colors of the room , very elegant Now coffee , why is it so hard on u guys to put a coffee maker in the rooms , YES sometimes we feel like drinking coffee in the afternoon without the need to make a request (there are people who like their life simpler ) bathtub doesnt drain water , so water was sitting till the next morning , I told the conceirge , her answer was "ok !" not even a sorry and that made me decide to leave right away and when we left , same scenario , three helping us to to carry , One handbag and a computer bag It's a nice hotel so it's really sad to see it like that

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of an Emperor or Empress”
Reviews.Author: kooltraveler84
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palomar and it was a really great experience. From the the moment I arrived everyone was so helpful and friendly. And the inside is really smart and cool. . No really, inside its modern, sophisticated, and DEFINITELY feel as if I am in Los Angeles. It has that cool, yet upscale look. I would say its "trendy" but not annoying or too cool for school like some other LA Boutique hotels. It has a COMPLIMENTARY, yes complimentary wine hour everyday from 5-6!!! I'm not a lush but who doesn't love free drinks. Im seriosly excited about this place and I joined their points program because I wanna stay here again and see their other hotels. They have a really cool one opening in Miami. Im actually at work right now writing this review because I want to come back! They have free wi-fi, which for business I really need. Its right in one of the nicest neigborhoods in LA, right next to beverly hills, bel-air. westwood and really close to santa monica. The bed was extremely comfortable, I was basically sleeping on a cloud in heaven. Their restaurant is really delcious also. But mostly what makes the huge difference is the service. Everyone is so eager to help and make you feel really comfortable and at home. Like I said, this is fit for and Emperor, or Empress, a really hip and cool Emperor or Empress

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and loved every minute! Stunning lobby. Nice room with great view. Loved the big plasma tv and modern finishes. Free wine between 5 and 6 every night. Full service continental breakfast in lounge-like restaurant. One negative, $30 per day parking was a bit much we thought. There is parking on side streets (Selby) , just read signs. Very close to Beverly Hills in beautiful Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in All Respects!”
Reviews.Author: roberto08
Reviews.Content: Our early August stay at the Hotel Palomar -Westwood was wonderful! It is such a thoughtfully conceived hotel. The guest rooms, gym, pool, and above all, service, exceeded our expectations. After this introduction, we are staying at The Palomar as often as possible in our travels!

Reviews.Title: “Palomar needs to work on the details...”
Reviews.Author: tchoneymonner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just okay. It was well kept and had a modern style that was appealing (however we found the amount of animal prints used from the bathrobes to the bedding, a bit much). The hotel had some issues that we didn't appreciate. First of all, we noticed that the staff, although quite attentive, were pretentious and sometimes rude. Twice while we were there and asked questions regarding a charge on your room that we were unaware of, we got the "well this is a 4 star hotel and this kind of charge is quite normal for this type of a hotel." I thought that kind of attitude was unneccsary, as we stay in 4 and 5 star resorts frequently and it had nothing do do with the unauthorized charge on our card. They finally rectified the unauthorized charge (with an attitude), but this kind of behavior was constant throughout the staff, and was just unnecessary. Also, I'm not sure if it was just an issue when we were staying there, but the TV's had very limited channels. Some of the few channels that actually worked had signal problems and very bad reception. We found this annoying when you just wanted to watch TV before bed and relax. They mention how amazing their hotel is constantly while you're there, one would think that having basic, working TV channels would be standard. As previous review have mentioned there is a coffee and tea bar in the mornings from 6am-9am. We would have preferred to have a coffee maker in the room or in addition to the bar in the lobby (standard for all levels of hotels now). There were times when I was working from my room and wanted a cup of coffee in the middle of the day, but had no access to it since the coffee/tea bar was long gone and there was no way to make coffee or hot water in my room. Parking is steep at $30 a day, but the valets are attentive and bring your car around promptly. These are all small details, but things that the we thought The Palomar truly overlooked. It seems that more thought is put into the design and pretentiousness of the hotel, with less focus on the guests. The beds however, were quite comfortable with plenty of pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Except It Needs Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: Boy_Scout
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar Los Angeles does all the right things, but be prepared to take a luke warm shower. Being from the east coast, I was up most mornings around 4 AM. The 3 mornings I was at the hotel I had at best a luke warm shower each morning. I was traveling with two other business associates and they reported the same issue, at about the same time of the morning. Hot water was abundant in the evening. Other than the hot water, the Palomar is a very nice hotel and was very reasonably priced. I would have rated this hotel 5 stars if I hadn't had the hot water problem. This hotel was originally another brand and was recently refurbished as the Palomar. My room was attractive and quiet. The temperature control was good and the bed was very comfortable. The work station in the room was comfortable and efficient. Each morning the hotel had coffee in the lobby. Not just any coffee, but about the best coffee I've ever had. Each evening during my stay the hotel also had a wine hour in the lobby with different wines each night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeSD001
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at the Palomar partly because of the good reviews here. It exceeded our expectations. Nice room, everything looked new and spotlessly clean. Neat modern arty decor. We got a complimentary upgrade to a room with beautiful view of LA from the 17th floor. The bed was big and comfy with a bunch of fluffy pillows and a really warm comforter (actually too warm). Most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in a hotel. The staff was great. We didn't need them much, but they were friendly, helpful and efficient when we did. The two nights we were there, the room was extremely quiet. Probably due to the high floor we were on and not many people being around. Some people have noted that the A/C is very noisy. In our room, it wasn't. We could hear it turning on, but the sound was not loud by any stretch. Nice touches - 42" LCD HD TV, large room safe, plush bath robes, high quality shampoo/conditioner. The hotel is in a good location. We caught a movie at the theatre a safe two block walk away. Or you can walk to Westwood Village. Drive down Wilshire Blvd. and there are a ton of stores and restaurants. Hop on the freeway to the Getty Center (which we did and had a great time) or Santa Monica Beach. A few nits - you cannot control the water flow in the sink faucet, only the temperature. More than a few times, I ended up splashing water all over the place due to the high water pressure. You hang up towels to reuse, but they get replaced anyway. Parking is $30 a day, valet only. That didn't bother me much though given the low room rate. We got the AAA rate of $161 a night on a holiday weekend. What a great deal! We really enjoyed our stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: spiraki
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded my expectations, it was a great value and ideally located. The staff were very attentive to our needs from check-in 2 check-out. It was fantastic to be able to walk outside and be centrally located. The rooms were tasteful, comfortable, very well mainted and super clean. Blvd 16 offered fantastic food and service. I plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Hotel Scene in Westwood/La”
Reviews.Author: Arizona1940
Reviews.Content: I want to say this was a delightful hotel. Well run and the staff were outstanding. The room decor and amenity's were perfect. It was a good location, and made my stop over part of my very long journey from Asia very nice and much easier., and most important memorable Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Palomar”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
