Reviews.Content: We chose The Palomar for a one night stay at the back end of a trip to California because it was a new hotel, in a convenient area, and we enjoyed a stay at another Kimpton property earlier this year. Overall we enjoyed our time here and it offered good value, but we would not want to stay at this hotel for more then a night or two. If you have stayed at a Kimpton hotel, you know the room dÃ©cor is always unique and a little different. At this location, we did not love the look of the room. The colors were mostly black and brown, with some splashes of brighter colors thrown in. There were too many patterns in the room including a snake skin pattern on the face of the dresser. The room came across as too dark and busy, and not very relaxing. As others have mentioned, the room was a little small as was the bathroom. South facing rooms have nice views, North facing rooms overlook busy Wilshire Boulevard and condos. I believe the hotel used to be a Doubletree before Kimpton took over, and was not built from the ground up as a new hotel. The rest of the hotel is pretty nice with a good boutique hotel feel with a little clublike atmosphere thrown in. We did not use the restaurant but we did check out the pool. The pool is decent size but the pool area is long, narrow, and lined up very close to the building. There are two attractive conversation areas but only five or six oversized lounge chairs for sitting in the sun at a hotel with over 200 rooms. We were at the pool late in the afternoon so some were available, but this is not a hotel for very many people to hang out by the pool. Overall The Palomar is a nice hotel with a central location. The staff was also very friendly and the happy hour is a nice touch rarely found at big city hotels. But not everyone will like the rooms and in a great weather city like LA, the pool setup is not large enough for a hotel this size.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: yuh8n
Reviews.Content: This is a world class property. My wife and I travel the world and have never had a better experience. The food, the staff, the surroundings, I will certainly be back again. My wife had surgery and they were kind enough to host us for her recovery. They had a wheel chair waiting, fresh fruit in the room, and the most amazing room with the finest linens with an outstanding view of downtown LA and the Pacific. I hope that every person has the opportunity to experience the pinnacle of hospitality that this resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place!”
Reviews.Author: hedylarue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for a few nights and thought it was a great place. It was recently renovated and everything looks new. The rooms are a good size and are clean with comfortable beds. The bathrooms are also spacious and the toiletries were really nice. The decorating was cool if a little strange...we would have preferred a table and chairs to the chaise...but we loved the big flat screen TV. The business center was really nice offering computers with both a Mac and PC side. My only annoyance was that they charged for it, but a lot of places do. UCLA is nearby so there are quite a few cafes and shops within walking distance. We got an excellent rate that included valet which was great because I'm not sure where else you could park. The staff was super friendly and really helpful. They gave us a late checkout with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cdngirl7500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 4-day girl's weekend and had a great time. Rooms are clean and decor is great - very LA! The rooms and bathrooms are also a decent size so there is room for two girl's suitcases, shopping, etc. while still allowing room to move. The lobby has a nice sophisticated-but-comfortable vibe and there are all types who stay here - couples, families, business travellers, and those on trips with friends. And there are also pets - we were startled by a beautiful golden retriever when we got off the elevator one morning! Service is very good overall - attentive, friendly and very helpful. The concierge, Paul, made some great recommendations for a Saturday night out including AOC, which we didn't realize until afterwards was such a highly-regarded restaurant. He also gave tips on when to arrive at Bar Marmont so that we could be sure to enjoy the Saturday night vibe and miss the line! A few small things. Room service, although 24 hour, is expensive and the restaurant closes around 10 or 11, so come prepared if you get in on a late flight! There is also a very limited night menu (from 11 PM or 12 to 6 AM). Also seems that there are a fair number of new staff right now. They are all trying hard and doing a great job but some of them don't yet have a good knowledge of the area/sights and some processes - like an early morning check-out - were a little slow. But everyone is keen and friendly - the most important thing. This hotel is in a nice area but you do have to walk a bit to get to shopping, etc. But it's LA so to be expected - just about anyone visiting the city should be prepared to rent a car. Valet parking is $30/day. A little pricey but definitely cheaper than the downtown areas of a lot of major cities - San Fran, NY. We didn't look into other parking options so don't know if self-park is available. Overall a great stay for two girls looking for a fun weekend!

Reviews.Title: “incredible and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: peacewellnesscenter
Reviews.Content: We found the Palomar Hotel to be beautiful, first rate and very customer oriented. We were treated like royality and felt like our vacation was worth the trip. Great Job to everyone there. We will be coming back!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my birthday, my housband and I decided to make a trip to L.A., and after an exhousting search, decided to book the Palomar in Westwood. It was our first time in the area, and were very pleased with the location of the hotel. It's on Wilshire Blvd and eventhough its not on a commercial zone, (The Westwood Village its about a 10 min. walk) the area its beautiful, full of trees and charming houses, we had the chance to walk in the neigborhood and were delighted ! The hotel its very modern, super clean and well decorated. The rooms are very comfortable, the bed is super, the pillows and linens are very nice, and the bathroom has a nice size too. Very good service at the restaurant and the food is good but a little expensive. A plus are the wine hour from 5-6 p.m, and coffee and tea bar in the morning. All the staff is very attentive. Also I want to recommend if you're in the area: Vincenti restaurant its the best italian I've ever visit!!! It's in Brentwood and its a 5-8 min. cab ride, very well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Gregory_Lison
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this hotel and on arrival was pleasantly surprised to find that the manager was from another Los Angeles hotel that I had stayed in some years back and more surprised that he remembered us! The hotel itself.. excellent location and the room as clean and well taken care of. The service and helpfulness of the staff/management were perfect and professional..thanks again for helping us arrange reservations for dinner and your suggestions on some things to do in Westwood. We will definitely be coming back in December and look forward to staying with you again. Regards. G E A

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: We switched our Los Angeles room booking to the Hotel Palomar at the last minute because I received a great deal via email from Kimpton. (I am a member of their In-Touch loyalty program.) The Hotel Palomar is relatively new, located in a remodeled former Doubletree. The building itself is pretty uninteresting, but the inside has received a huge makeover. The lobby was small-ish, but comfortable during the evening wine reception. The regular rooms felt a little on the small side, but I think this was mostly because there is too much large furniture packed into them. The king bed in our room was very very comfortable with great linens. There was also a desk, dresser, two nightstands, coffee table, and chaise lounge in the room. Our room looked exactly like the pictures on the website. The front desk staff was pleasant and housekeeping did an amazing job of keeping the room neat and clean. We ordered room service one night and the person delivering was very friendly and personable. Only the valets were a little surly. The location isn't very exciting, but it's near UCLA and very central for doing other things in the area. We were an easy drive from the Getty Center, Santa Monica, West Hollywood, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to miss with this new Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: RogerWM
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel, and were very pleased. The rooms were well appointed, very clean, the staff efficient, professional and extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Westwodd”
Reviews.Author: LittleCupcakes
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a not bad one night stay at the Kimpton Westwood. I was in town to see a play at UCLA and the hotel was well-located for that purpose. The rooms were nice, not great, and a touch on the small size (I had a Deluxe View room). The view was indeed terrific, but they charge a bit more for view rooms. There was excellent water pressure, and the bed was very comfy. Check in and out was quick and efficient, and the staff were helpful at every turn. The bar staff in particular impressed me. Even though the small but stylish (actually, nearly everything at the hotel was small and stylish) bar was nearly empty, these folks were running around doing all sorts of work, instead of leaning back and texting while waiting for closing time. Bad news: the minibar in the room rattled all night, and the A/C system was quite loud. The elevators were slow. All in all, a good stay. It's not cheap, but if need a cool place near Westwood, you could do much worse.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mig_8115
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove up the valet person gave us all their attention. At the front desk everyone used my last name and the checkin process was quick and eazy.. The whole staff was great, the room was amazingly clean and the view made me feel like i should be paying alot more. What i really liked was the complementary wine served at the lobby. I was really impressed with the service, you dont find a hotel like this very often.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar - Westwood Los Angeles is simply Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: PalmSpringsSpanky07
Reviews.Content: From begining to end a great experience. Excellent welcome and friendly valet staff. The front desk transaction was seemless! We loved that this was a pet friendly hotel. The room was amazing they really did this place up with quality materials. Unlike most hotels the restaurant was wonderful. Try and get the private dining area on the right side... The location allowed us to hit Beverly Hills for shopping and than go to my medical appointment on monday at UCLA. Just Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “The finest hotel in LA for it's price, just add self parking option”
Reviews.Author: Ronald_1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the Palomar hotel in Westwood, mostly based on location, an attractive 50% off offer on Expedia and its #1 ranking on Tripadvisor. And this is sure the ranking this former Doubletree hotel, now stylish renovated by Kimpton, deserves. Not just for the big spotless rooms with countless amenities like a huge LCD TV and the best king I've slept on during my whole 4 week stay in the USA or the excellent location (just minutes away from Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and UCLA) in a safe neighboorhood. Most of all this hotel is my new LA favorite spot because of the most attentive and truly friendly staff. From front office, to bell and valet everybody gives you that warm welcome feeling like you are at home and will do almost everything to make your stay as pleasant as possible. I cannot remember any other hotel on the many trips I've made to the USA where I found a similar experience. They even offer a complimentary wine hour, but we were to busy exploring LA to join ! Only thing missing was a balcony to enjoy the streetlife or hotel view and the WiFi reception was unfortunality rather bad. But nevertheless this hotel would be my choice again next time (hopefully again with a good Expedia offer 'cause their rack rates are kinda pricy for me, though worth the money). Final remark is that the hotel parking is also pricy (USD 30 overnight) and they only offer valet service. As an European I'd prefer to do the parking myself (although the valets are most attentive) but I simply find self parking more comfortable. So it would be perfect if the hotel would offer self parking too, their indoor parking lot is huge and the infrastructure surely allows possibility of self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, exceptional staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tibsenkid
Reviews.Content: Usually stayed in West Hollywood, but, heard from a friend about this place in Westwood. Tried it out and found everything, from the welcoming front desk folks to the housekeepers, not to mention the fabulous bed, made it one of the nicest hotel stays I've experienced in a long time...and I just stayed at the St. Regis in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nelliebearLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel arrived late and was upgraded to a Suit. Great Valet parking, try the free wine in the evenings had dinner in restaurant food was good and nice selection. overall beautiful hotel no problems clean and boutique.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TheFunBear
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived the staff was extremely gracious and helpful. Check in was a breeze, and advice from the concierge was very helpful on what to do in the area and how to get around town. I booked a Vista Deluxe room and was not disappointed in the least, bed was comfy, room was quiet, nice big TV, nice bathroom, good water pressure in shower...all good. One of my friends booked a Spa Suite, it was Awesome, I have to admit, I was just a bit jealous... We hung out with our friends one night in the hotel restaurant Blvd 16 and had a great time and tried most of the appetizers which were great. I wish we would have given the entrees a try, but maybe next time... The chef even came over and took a minute to sit with us, he mentioned that the hotel is also pet friendly which we didn't know. It was nice to run into someone who loves dogs as much as we do! All in all, a great experience at the Palomar, I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite found its soul yet”
Reviews.Author: JeffBarnes
Reviews.Content: Let me firstly say that there is nothing wrong at all about this hotel. It is in excellent condition (quite new I believe), the staff are friendly and helpful and the room we had was absolutely fine - especially the bed. It just seems to lack an identity and character which I expect will come in time. The location is not great as it sits on the busy Wilshire Boulevard (not noisy inside though) and it is a good walk to find somewhere to eat if you want to step out rather than eat in the restaurant which is soulless. The best place to go is up towards UCLA. Forget the pool - it seems to be an afterthought and barely gets the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: focuscc
Reviews.Content: We had a 7 night stay as part of our annual holiday to the USA from the UK. The room was small for 3 people (me, wife and 13 yr old daughter), the beds were only regular double size and not the usual queen that we get in Florida but the room would have felt even smaller if they were. There was no mirror in the main room which caused problems when you have 2 ladies trying to get ready at the same time, we ended up having to buy a mirror from Walmart. Like others have said the A/C was noisy but because we were so tied from all day sightseeing it only caused slight inconvenience, in fact the A/C from another room woke me up more than ours!!! The $30 valet parking was expensive especially when you include a tip every time you want it. For the 7 nights it would have cost $210 + tips so after the 1st night I parked in the street 1 block down as parking was free between 08:00 am to 06:00 pm and 2 hrs during. Because we were out all day I had free parking from 10:00 am to 04:00 pm and never had a problem finding a space and only 2-3 minute walk. As I don't drink wine it would have been nice if beer was offered as an alternative during the free happy hour. We did have to call the front desk at 02:00 am Saturday as the next room guests were playing loud music and singing along (badly), but security was sent to the room and it got quiet from then on. Overall it was a pleasant stay but I would find someware different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, modern in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Mission_world
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we were greeted by Eric who was there to take our bags to the rooms. He was a great guy with a friendly manner who was genuinely happy to help us and give us some guidance about the place. The rooms were modern and chique, however the lighting was a little low. Beds were clean and comfortable and the bathrooms were spotless and well appointed. We enjoyed our stay so much we returned there at the end of our trip for the final night before flying out of LA. Good location, a short walk to some good restaurants and a short drive to Beverley Hills. Valet parking was efficient and very convenient, and again manned by very pleasant staff. We thought that this was an excellent choice for staying in this region and at a resonable rate. We would stay here again when visiting the Beverley Hills & Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice but.....”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_SF
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed over a Fri/Sat night weekend. First off, the location is super safe and can't be beat. It's on a great stretch of Wilshire Blvd., next to Westwood/UCLA, close to Santa Monica, LAX, etc... and beautful residentail neighborhoods.I thought the front staff to be very accomodating and nice. The hotel is chi chi boutique, the rooms are smaller but nicely furnished, the restaurant had really great food, i was surprised by that. The pool area in the back is totally cute as well. Downside, the A/C is extremely loud! Like crazy loud. It scared me! I couldn't sleep with it on and during the day, i tried not to listen to it. An engineer came up and checked it and said I actually had a quieter room. I could tell this was a refurbished older property, as I could also hear the upstairs shower & sink, something you expect in a motel. The $30 a day parking was steep but at the same time, it was kinda convenient, becuase you just went out front and in a minute, the valet had your car for you, so you pay for your convenience. I only paid $179 which was i think worth it in this area, however if i had to pay something like over $300, i'd rather fork out at one of the older grander hotels for that kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aftab-D
Reviews.Content: Great location, great accomodations, great design. I had dinner in the restaurant and ordered room service for breakfast, In both cases the food and service was outstanding. The hotel deserves an A. I will return again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get good price”
Reviews.Author: DANTRIPFREE
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel in a very good location. Really a good choice if you'd like to visit the best of LA. Close to BH, Bel Air, Holliwood, Ucla, ecc. The hotel is really new but the AC was very, very loud in my room. Good hotel but...quite expensive...wait for the right price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SJP2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in July and August, first off with my family on vacation, and secondly on a business trip. I have to say that in both capacities the Palomar really excelled. In terms of the location both the easy journey to LAX and the walkable trip to Westwood Village/UCLA were both advantages. Public transport in LA is finally starting to improve and the stopping bus service down Wilshire (to the heart of Beverly Hills)stops very close to the hotel. The rooms are really comfortable and functional, WiFi was faultless, but as some reviewers have noticed some AC units seemed over noisy (only a problem in my second room). Complimentary morning coffee and tea in the lobby were a nice touch. I didn't have an opportunity to enjoy the wine tasting, but passing through the lobby at that time there seemed to be plenty of happy punters. The GM, John Douponce, used to be at that other tripadvisor/LA favourite Le Montrose, at which I have also stayed, and it seems that with this property the idea is to have take a 'boutique hotel' design style and bring it to a larger space. It really works. I would highly recommend this property and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: hannahkumar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king bed suite for 5 nights. after reading the reviews on trip advisor. What a Nightmare. The hotel is located at the center of everything, the Rooms are okay but the noise is terrible . None of us could sleep all night . The AC was too loud and we were given the top floor so the room was very hot and we were not able to use the AC because of the noise,. The Road noise was the worst, every single second we were able to here the traffic. It is not worth the money. The front desk Staff were very indifferent to our problem. Please don't stay in this hotel Hannah

Reviews.Title: “way too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: ck_in_the_OC
Reviews.Content: beware, the expense does not end with the room charge! for a famiy of 4 to sightsee in la, we booked this hotel because of its central location. my husband is a frequent business traveler LA and says that downtown is not safe at night. we balked a little at spending more than $300, but figured we'd have this SUPER room. for the price we got a average sized room with artsy furniture. the room was not ready when we arrived and the toilet would not work unless you took off the top of the tank to manually flush it. we were shocked at the $30/day parking. we made the mistake of ordering a pot of coffee and 4 OJs one morning and couldn't believe the charge was more than $60!! in summary it is a NICE hotel, but i don't think you get what you pay for. i've stayed in much nicer hotels for less. i would not go back there unless someone else was paying the bill.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: keithblaser
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 2 days and three nights along with my mother, father and sister. We loved every minute of it! The hotel was so warm and inviting it made it hard to leave everyday. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. The General Manager of the hotel, John Duponce, was at the front desk when we were checking in and came around to shake our hands and welcome us personally to his hotel. The rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. We loved the bathrooms! The restaurant, Bvd. 16, was absolutely beautiful. We expected the food to be average since we were dining in the hotel, but to our surprise it was amazing! The chef did an excellent job creating the menu. What we liked to take away from this hotel experience was the overall FEEL you get when it's all over. Sometimes its hard to pinpoint WHY we (people in general) feel a certain way. All we know is that it was good or bad. In this case, we felt at home, comfortable and taken care of. We felt good and Hotel Palomar made it happen. We will definately stay here again when we return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Westwood Winner”
Reviews.Author: aller et retour
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Palomar in Westwood for three nights earlier this month for a business trip and absolutely loved it. Got a great rate for a comfortable, clean, and stylish room. Staff is especially eager to help without coming off condescending or pretentious. Especially loved the free happy hour (they were generous with the wine pours!) and the iPod docking station/alarm clock. Since I was here on business, the free internet access was also appreciated. Unfortunately, I didn't bring a camera to take pictures of the place to attach to this review, but actually, I think the pictures they have on their website are very accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Shagadellic”
Reviews.Author: travellingchef81
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay in LA. I liked the morning coffee, location and privacy. rooms are very nice and attendants are detail oriented. My favorite place away from home. Bravo Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 'Modern' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fedexflyer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is the latest location in the Kimpton Group's chain of boutique hotels. All of the distinctive Kimpton touches are there - evening wine reception, premium morning coffee, very comfortable bed, L'Occitane toiletries, great upscale restaurant on-site. The Westwood-area hotel is easily accessed on Wilshire Blvd., which is good, since most area restaurants and shops will require a drive (or at least a very long walk). Everything looked new, which makes sense as the hotel was extensively renovated and has only been open as a Palomar for three months. The staff seemed friendly and eager, but unpolished (I generally don't expect to hear the terms 'cool' and 'awesome' being used by the staff during check-in). The rooms seemed somewhat smaller than usual, but were clean, and included both very nice details (42" flat panel television, chaise lounge, ample lighting with touch controls) and disappointing shortcuts (no HD on the TV, cheapish furniture). During my stay I was able to enjoy a dinner at BLVD 16, the combination restaurant/lounge just off the lobby. The food was good, the service was very attentive and the atmosphere was festive--the restaurant was still quite busy at 10 at night. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and recommend the Palomar, particularly if you like your hotel with lots of 'attitude'.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto the below review...an excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: lagunadallas
Reviews.Content: I usually write pretty detailed (and hopefully helpful!) reviews, but I just saw the new review below from 'bocafive' and my experience was absolutely identical on all counts. I've stayed at most of the $400+ per night L.A. hotels, and for less than half of the price, the Palomar was exceptional. To echo bocafive's experience, we enjoyed the convenience of the location, fantastic value, quality and style of the renovations given it's an older hotel, the friendly and efficient staff, and free wireless access. The a/c might be a little loud as others have said, and the walls are on the thin side, but neither of those issues did anything to diminish the quality of our stay. The one thing I wasn't expecting was the huge wine reception crowd in the lobby when we arrived, which made it very loud and chaotic, but it was much more peaceful and quite attractive environment later in the evening when we returned from dinner. This location is fantastic for anyone visiting UCLA or Beverly Hills businesses, as the BH border is just a couple of minutes up Wilshire. Kimpton seems to be pretty generous with perks for its repeat guests --- I got a ridiculously low rate with free parking via an email offer as a prior Palomar San Francisco guest. I'd suggest that anyone considering a stay here (or at any Kimpton) sign up for their special offer email in case something like this is offered again. Overall --- sure, I'd rather stay at the Peninsula or the Beverly Wilshire, but I can only swallow their big rates on more special occasions. I've shopped the competition, and especially under $250, I think the Palomar is the best overall value in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Some Quirks, but Overall A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: UprightAndStowed
Reviews.Content: A really great energy fills this place, which delivers a solid four-star experience. The decor is a little quirky â€“ but all Kimpton properties are. Think poor-man's Philippe Stark. And the service is inconsistent. Some terrific, really friendly and professional staff. And some who are just too casual. The wine hour and free coffee in the lobby are excellent, really adding to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST...”
Reviews.Author: HIPPINO
Reviews.Content: We have just left the hotel: what a wonderful experience!!! The hotel is brand new and the staff is incredibly helpful. Our room, a king deluxe, was decorated with design furniture and in the wardrobe we found bathrobes (Roberto Cavalli style). In the lobby, you can have a cup of coffee in the morning and a glass of wine in the evening. The location is also great: Westwood is quiet, but near all the attractions. Don't forget to plan a visit to the Getty Musuem: the view is stunning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: bocafive
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my last night before flying home from Los Angeles. I stayed at that Beverly Hills Hotel and Shutters on the Beach before the Palomar/Westwood. Although the Beverly Hills hotel is in a different catagory...the Palomar was an excellent value and a fine choice for tourists and business people alike. I booked the hotel at 189 on a AAA rate which was a great price for a great LA location (Wilshire Blvd). The hotel is older and recently renovated. Check in was first rate, the valet was super friendly and smiling and they knew my name by the time I approached the front desk. The staff were really friendly and welcoming. My room was a typical sized chain hotel layout but the renovations and decor were really edgy and super comfortable. Great linens, great big screen television, desk, FREE wifi, and a cool bathroom with stylish sink/ammenities. Of note, the hotel offers a free wine hour in the evening which was well attended, the lobby is eclectic with a fireplace, very comfortable. Hotel security was visable and reassuring. I did not get to the pool or restaurant. I want to give kudos to the front desk staff. My son and I went to Westwood village for a movie and could not find a cab to take us back to the hotel. I called the desk and they dispatched a cab to us in just a few minutes. When we were checking out they gave us detailed information to get to the Orange County airport. Great job! This hotel is great for those who want a great location, great service and a reasonable price. I will return there when in LA. The hotel is a welcome addition to the Los Angeles market and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroadagain055
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this Hotel. It was evident that the Hotel had just undergone a complete renovation and the finished product looked great. The decor was very hip. The building and grounds were clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and attentive to my needs. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanderingStar61
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay at at this hotel, great location, great staff. Excellent personal touches such as providing water in your car when the valet returns it. Coffee in the morning and wine in the evening in the lobby are nice amenities but the lobby can get a little chaotic in the evening particularly if checking in. Other than that, a fine hotel and one that i will return to

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MikeDJ
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience! New paint, carpets and a few pieces of cool furniture can't disguise the inherent shortcomings of this renovated hotel. (I am told it used to be a Doubetree, and that's the level it remains at). The rooms are too small, the AC is so loud you want to cover your ears the whole time you are in the room, and the walls are so thin that even if you turn yours off you'll hear your neighbor's AC (not to mention their bathroom visits). And don't get me started on the pool: tucked away in what feels like an alley behind the hotel (between the hotel's dumpster and the washing facility), with a grand total of five sunbathing chairs -- try fighting for one on a Saturday afternoon - and a bunch of shared couches. Half the equipment in the fitness center fails to work properly. True, the staff are friendly, but this "boutique" hotel is a joke.
